Address: 742 N Anderson Rd, Rock Hill, SC 29730
Description: Specialty coffee shop focused on providing insight into the farmers, their lives, and the education of coffee WITHOUT JUDGEMENT. From savory breakfast sandwiches to our in-house bakes scones, enjoy a cup in the co-working space at 742 North and chillax to our smooth playlists.
Comments:
So, I don't actually drink coffee, despite running a website that aims to have just about every coffee shop in the greater Charlotte area on it. I’m a tea guy, and this place takes tea seriously. They make their own herbal blends, and they’re incredible. The Blue Bellini is one of my favorites, but they’ve also got Hibiscus Berry, Masala Chai, Rosemary Bramble, and more. There’s even a dedicated tea menu that lists all the herbs in each blend. The respect for tea lovers here is a solid 10 out of 10. And uh, I'm sure the coffee is great too.
The space is shared with a few other businesses, including a podcast studio and a co-working area. That gives it a creative, laid-back energy. There are places to sit and work scattered throughout. I’m not totally sure where the coffee shop seating ends and the co-working space begins, but the vibe is friendly enough that I figure someone would politely point it out if you accidentally wandered into the wrong spot.
The staff is warm and genuine. It’s not the usual trendy barista scene with cool tattoos, nose rings, perfectly tousled hair, and the silent judgment of your drink order. No shade to those folks, but this crew feels different. They seem like they’re from Rock Hill, and that local, grounded energy stands out in a region packed with transplants.

Description: Haraz honors our Yemeni heritage—home to the world’s first coffee culture—with beans grown at 3,000+ ft in the mountains of Haraz. As first-generation immigrants, we celebrate coffee’s power to bring people together through tradition and hospitality. Ask a team member for a validation code for up to 4 hours of free garage parking.
Comments:
Just as beautiful as the original Charlotte location in Elizabeth, but I give this one a leg up because it's bigger. They've nailed this "modern but not cookie cutter" aesthetic that reflects the Yemeni culture behind the business. The coffee is marvelous. I don’t even drink coffee, but I usually get something when I come here. The red tea is great too. 
There’s free street parking, but it's all parallel and pretty limited. Official parking is in the garage owned by the South & Hollis apartment complex. The rates are ridiculous, and they don’t use ParkMobile, they’ve got their own thing. Haraz will validate, but personally, I’d rather park down the street than give some random parking company all my info. But that’s just me, data privacy nerd over here. As for LoSo, I think it has officially arrived as its own thing. 
There are too many cool spots in the area to deny it. Thousand Hills Coffee and The Everyday Market are right across the street, both great third places. And there’s a ton of other spots within walking distance. Plus, it's right on the train line, so if you live in South End, you don’t even have to drive to get here.

Description: Nestled inside Meck Church, the Grounds Bookstore and Café was founded in 2012. This unique destination seamlessly blends the love of books with the warmth of a coffeeshop, making it a tranquil space for people to come together. Whether you're working, meeting a friend, walking our nature trail, or reading, we have a spot for you to enjoy! Each purchase contributes to supporting worthy global and local missions and Meck ministries, making every visit a meaningful act of kindness that makes a profound difference.
Comments: If I lived on this side of town, I’d go to this church just to hang out here. It’s that well done. The space is huge, with a ground-floor bookstore, an upstairs loft with even more seating, and a sizeable outdoor patio that's great for reading with a view. If you’re looking for a place to work or study and want a guaranteed seat, this is the spot. It’s inside a church, but the entrance to the café is clearly marked and tucked off to the side, so you won’t accidentally wander into a service. And to take things over the top, they even have a walking trail called the "Meck Trail." Ask the staff where the entrance is. It’s thoughtfully designed with Bible verse signs placed along the path. Most of the trail is lined with trees and covered in gravel, so you get that peaceful outdoors vibe without dealing with mud. Since it’s a church bookstore, most of the books are Christian, which I love as a Christian myself. The café sells Honeybear Bake Shop pastries, who boast some of the best cinnamon rolls in Charlotte. They also have a solid tea selection, good coffee, and a friendly staff that’s always ready to help. Outlet access is decent. Downstairs is limited, but upstairs there are desks and tables with power strips nearby. Seating is a mix of leather chairs with metal frames, modern café-style chairs, and plenty of four-top tables. It feels like this place was built with intention. Not just a café or bookstore, but a true third place, somewhere you can linger, recharge, and feel welcomed. There’s just so much to like about it.

Description: Counter-serve bakery/cafe chain serving sandwiches, salads & more, known for its bread & free WiFi.
Counter-serve bakery/cafe chain serving sandwiches, salads & more, known for its bread & free WiFi.

Address: 4701 Goose Crk Dr Ste B, Charlotte, NC 28269
Description: Summit Coffee is a neighborhood cafe creating moments of joy through good coffee, genuine hospitality, and a space built for community. We're serving up NC roasted coffee, tea and freshly baked pastries daily!
Comments: As is consistently the case across Summit Coffee locations, it’s a clean, modern, airy setup with great drinks and a welcoming atmosphere. This spot in particular gets great natural lighting from wall sized windows on the opposite ends of the building. There’s good access to outlets and enough seating to feel relatively confident that you’ll be able to snag a spot.

Place: Jade and Elise Obsidian Coffee Co.
Address: 7005 Wilkinson Blvd Apt D, Belmont, NC 28012
Description: We are a coffee shop that is in Belmont!
Comments: This spot has a cozy, intimate vibe with a warm, wood-paneled aesthetic that feels straight out of someone’s home kitchen. It’s small, but charming. The seating is mostly arranged family-style with a central long table then several 4-top groupings. The parrot mural on the counter adds a fun pop of color, and the Colombian flag on the shelf is a nod to the owners' roots. They own a coffee farm in Colombia, and you can taste that connection in the coffee and pastries they serve. It’s not a spot to hunker down for hours and work, but it’s perfect for catching up with a friend or enjoying something sweet in a welcoming space. If you're in the area, it's worth a stop just for the warm energy alone.

Address: 9623 Red Stone Dr Suite 500, Indian Land, SC 29707
Description: Local chain serving coffee, tea & shakes, plus pastries & light eats, in a stylish, relaxed space.
Comments: Marvelous outlet access, 10/10. Makes it a great spot to work from. It's similar to a Caribou Coffee in that they offer coffee, tea, great sandwiches, pastries, and a variety of other drinks. What sets them apart is the artwork. Local artists have pieces displayed on the walls that are available for sale, giving their work some well-deserved exposure. The space has a modern coffee shop aesthetic. Mostly metal or hard wooden chairs and faux marble tables. Clean, sleek, and businesslike. It's not particularly standout in terms of style, but it looks good and serves its purpose well. I wouldn't call it cozy, but it is comfortable, and that makes it ideal if you're looking for a place to study or get some work done.

Address: 153 E White St Unit B, Rock Hill, SC 29730
Description: The Jackass Café, Deli & Wine Bar is a café bar located in the back of The Mercantile HQ. Located in the historical Coca-Cola bottling building, The Jackass Café is full of our favorite local coffee, tea, wine & pastries. Visit our café in Rock Hill, SC today!
Comments: This spot is attached to The Mercantile, a large general store with cool trinkets, gifts, and a folksy kind of vibe. Great food, wine, coffee, tea, and some pastry options. The aesthetic is artsy and earthy, full of personality. Definitely not your typical cookie-cutter modern coffee shop. Visiting here can easily turn into a whole day trip. It's within walking distance of Knowledge Perk, Rock Hill Coffee, Amelie's Rock Hill, and a bunch of local shops. When you're ready to wind down, head to nearby Fountain Park. Bring a book, grab a nice drink, and do some people watching. Plenty of Rock Hill date nights end up at this park. Or just read your book 😅. It feels like a scene straight out of a movie, the kind they always used to cast Drew Barrymore in.

Description: Relationships and coffee go hand in hand. At CrossRidge Cafe, our love for people and our love for coffee will brighten your day. Come, let us serve you, and leave with a full heart!
Comments: This place is part of the CrossRidge Center business park, but the café is open to the public. It's usually quiet unless there's an event, which makes it feel like a hidden gem. There's tons of seating, including recessed nooks, couches, bookshelves, and tables that give it a cozy, library-like vibe. Great spot to read or get focused work done without feeling like you're in the middle of everything. The café has a full food menu, Harney & Sons loose leaf tea, coffee, and cold drinks. No cinnamon rolls but they do have pastries and a cinnamon cheesecake that's 🔥. There's also a cool fountain with tall stone structures right behind the front desk you pass on the way in, making the whole place feel even more peaceful. And just a short walk away at Inspiration Ministries, there's a large park with fountains, ponds, seating, and waterside walkways that make this entire area feel like even more of a hidden gem.

Address: 605 Jetton St Suite B, Davidson, NC 28036
Description: Cozy, trendy coffee shop serving up caffeinated drinks such as lattes and cortados, plus desserts like croissants.

The Coffeeshop is a cozy, family-owned spot known for its high-quality coffee and welcoming vibe. We’ve partnered with Night Swim Roasters in Charlotte to bring you the freshest, locally roasted beans, and we offer a selection of delicious baked goods from The Bakery Shop in Huntersville. Whether you're grabbing a quick coffee, settling in to work with our free WiFi, or enjoying a snack, The Coffeeshop is the perfect place to relax and recharge.

Get ready to experience the rich flavors of the Mediterranean! Anatolia Cafe & Cuisine brings you authentic Turkish and Mediterranean dishes, from savory kebabs to freshly baked pastries, paired with aromatic coffee and teas. We use only the finest ingredients to create a warm, inviting dining experience. We can’t wait to welcome you!
Comments: Has a bright, polished aesthetic that feels modern and upscale without being cold. The entire space is lined with door-sized windows, letting in tons of natural light and giving everything a clean, airy vibe. The interior design blends deep blues, marble tabletops, patterned tile, and soft gray tones. Makes the space feel fresh and refined. There’s plenty of seating, with solid outlet access along the back wall and near the fire alarms by the windows, making it a good spot to get some work done. The Turkish food here is amazing. Specifically the Turkish pizza options are 🔥. Their bathrooms have mirrors with built-in lighting you can control with touch-sensitive buttons. Very cool. As for the name, Anatolia refers to the ancient region that makes up most of modern-day Turkey, a crossroads of civilizations, so it’s fitting that the space feels both timeless and stylish.

Description: Here at Your Mom's Donuts, we're not about ordinary. We aren't about a stale chocolate donut with sprinkles. We don't believe preservatives or artificial colors belong in donuts. We don't believe that donuts should be produced on an assembly line. We think every donut should be a masterpiece. We think supporting local farms is cool. We think bringing you donuts that are filled with quality ingredients is even cooler. We think words like "bliss" and "heavenly" should come to mind when you bite into one of our donuts. We think your mouth will agree.
Comments: They’ve got glorious cream cheese frosting cinnamon rolls, along with a solid lineup of donuts and coffee. The interior is modern, with fun donut-themed designs on the walls and a friendly staff to match. It’s less of a spot to work from and more of a place to read, catch up with friends, sip some coffee, and indulge in cinnamon rolls (the greatest of all pastries).

Address: 2012 Bridgemill Dr Suite 100, Indian Land, SC 29707
Description: Food, coffee, wine, beer, cocktails, mocktails and more! We have something for everyone!
Comments: Bright modern space with a very calming feel to it. They've got plenty of stuff, food, hot and cold drinks, alcohol, bagels, and croissants. They've got this honey butter croissant that's immaculate. You'll want to check your blood sugar after eating it, but it's marvelous. Great interior setup in terms of seating that feels tucked away. Excellent access to outlets inside, and they have plenty of outdoor seating, with a few spots out there even having outlet access.

Address: 2024 Bridgemill Dr Suite 112, Indian Land, SC 29707
Description: Teaplus is a boba tea shop originally founded in Boca Raton, Florida, known for its signature cheese foam—creamy, lightly sweet, and perfectly salted to complement their freshly brewed teas. Each drink is hand-crafted with high-quality ingredients for a rich, refreshing experience.
Comments: Beautifully designed space, small but thoughtful. The floor looks cool. Not the boring industrial chic unfinished style that’s trendy these days, somebody actually wax finished the thing. Good for them. While it’s small, it’s right next to Rendezbrew, a favorite spot of mine with plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. So this complex as a whole is worth a visit. Very bubbly and social staff. More than willing to chat if you’re into that. They have a million cold tea options but also Asian food, the dumplings and ramen are good. And there’s some really cool anime action figures to the left of the counter. Super Saiyan 2 Goku, Super Saiyan Fusion Goku, God Fusion Goku, Goku Black’s Super Saiyan Rosé form, and various characters from Slam Dunk (the OG basketball anime, before Kuroko no Basket!). Huge anime fan here, respect to whoever set those up!

Address: 16709 Orchard Stone Run Ste300, Charlotte, NC 28277
Comments: Small space with some extra seating outdoors. The indoor seating lines the main walkway, so everyone in the store ends up in your view. If you’re easily distracted by movement, you probably won’t love this layout, unless you grab a seat outside. If you’re planning to work or study, I’d only come on a warm day so you have that outdoor option if the inside fills up. Very pristine, modern aesthetic, mostly white with pops of color throughout. No cinnamon rolls, but a good variety of interesting pastries, plus solid coffee, tea, and other drinks. The hot pomegranate green tea is my go-to.

Description: Cakeable is a nonprofit café and bakery dedicated to empowering adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities through inclusive vocational training and meaningful employment opportunities. Interns develop valuable job skills, foster community connections, and create high-quality baked goods and café offerings. Cakeable proudly contributes to a joyfully inclusive Charlotte community where everyone can thrive.

Address: 413 Dalton Ave Suite B, Charlotte, NC 28206
Description: Award winning Craft Brewery and Taproom in North End Charlotte situated between Avid Exchange Music Factory, Camp North End, and Optimist Hall. Kid and Dog- friendly. Offering Craft Beer, Cider, Seltzer, Sours, Wines, Kombucha, CBD seltzers, and Snacks. Food Truck schedule posted weekly on Instagram. Family- Friendly. Open- air patio with Skyline views. Pub- style taproom welcoming to all, with secret room- a blend of library, speakeasy, church, cigar lounge, and dive bar. A hidden gem hiding in plain sight.
Comments: This is my pick for the best brewery in Charlotte for reading. The whole aesthetic leans eclectic Victorian library, with dim lighting, antique sofas, couches, and lounge chairs. There’s even a bookcase with a hidden room behind it, which sometimes has a few pinball machines. I love the booth-style seats tucked behind the bar to the right when you first walk in. Super cozy nooks that are perfect for settling in with a book. They don’t serve food, but there’s usually a food truck parked outside offering solid options. Truly a standout in terms of personality amidst the crowded Charlotte brewery scene.

Address: APEX Southpark, 4425 Sharon Rd S120, Charlotte, NC 28211
Description: Welcome to Gourmand Market! Discover our extensive market filled with local gourmet delights. Indulge in specialty coffees and sip on exquisite cocktails at our full-service bar. Our grab-and-go menu features specialty coffees, cocktails, and local gourmet items, from soup to nuts. Enjoy frozen, hot, cold, prepped, or made-to-order breakfast, lunch, and dinner options.
Comments: Very posh, ritzy, refined aesthetic. Black walls and furniture with gold, white, and gray accents throughout. It’s clearly designed to feel fancy, and the pricing reflects that. This place is unapologetically gourmet. There’s a coffee shop, pastries (including cinnamon rolls 🙏🏾🔥), bar, and market items. They have individually sold chilled Capri Suns, and I respect that. So it’s not entirely pretentious despite being upscale. There’s an upstairs area behind the bar, and that’s where most of the indoor seating is. It’s pretty cozy up there, mostly four-top tables and a few armchairs. The lighting is dim in a way that makes it feel calm and private, great spot to read a book or have a quiet meal away from a crowd. Downstairs, in addition to bar seating, there’s an outdoor patio with nice chairs. Parking is free on weekends, but since they share the garage with other businesses, you might have to pay depending on the day and time. Overall, a very fancy-feeling spot. It’s right next to Steak 48, a classic “we’re taking things to the next level” Charlotte date spot, so maybe swing through here after your next romantic outing.

Description: Backyard Brew is a family-owned and operated coffee and tea spot located in a house, in the historic district. We specialize in custom tailoring drinks to each person’s taste and wonderful customer experiences. Seeing you happy, makes us happy! We source and roast all of our ethically grown, organic coffee. We source and blend all of our own teas.
Comments: If you’ve ever been to Brakeman’s in Matthews this is like that but within the city. It’s literally a home, so cozy, warm, friendly vibes to the max. The walls are covered in handwritten notes from customers over the years and drawings. You could spend a good hour just reading the walls and the stories that go with them. There’s limited parking behind the house but there’s a Harris Teeter across the street you can park at if it’s packed. Great cozy spot for remote work, especially on warm days as you can sit on their porch. And they have cinnamon rolls 🔥. Awesome, locally owned, down-to-earth place.

Description: A social destination featuring duckpin bowling, dozens of classic pinball machines & many more ‘old school’ entertainment options along with high-quality cocktails and crafts beers served daily. Come Play!
Comments: Really cool retro arcade games, small ball bowling, and old console games (Sega Genesis, Nintendo NES, Super NES, and 64, but no GameCube or original Xbox, those are retro these days!). The console and arcade games are free. The track and field game is my favorite, it’s pretty accurate with the times and distances (former collegiate track athlete here). Huge space, comfy couches, and a bar. Gets really busy on the weekends, overwhelmingly so. But during the week it's pretty chill.

Address: 500 W Trade St Suite 101, Charlotte, NC 28202
Description: Coffee Republic Trade Street is the perfect coffee shop near you for rich, handcrafted coffee and fresh bakery treats and sandwiches. Enjoy pastries in a cozy space built for community and connection. Visit the best coffee shop in town today!
Comments: This spot has a great atmosphere for getting work done. It's cozy, but not in that countryside cabin, fall-asleep-with-a-book kind of way. It's more like, this chair is comfortable, the natural lighting (tall windows) is great, and I've got my own little corner to focus and be productive. Cozy with a buzz, not cozy with a nap. Outlet access is solid if you sit at the coffee bar, and while it's a little more limited by the smaller two-person tables, there are enough spots where your charger can reach. So outlet access really isn't an issue here at all. The food is seriously good, especially for a coffee shop. The breakfast items and pastries are way better than you'd expect. And they have cinnamon rolls 🔥. The aesthetic is modern with an artsy twist; neon signs, art-adorned walls, and sleek finishes everywhere. It's a nice departure from the industrial chic style you see in most places. Very IG and TikTok friendly, but still warm and welcoming.

Very personal setting and vibe offering a great experience. The cafe is faith-based, black-owned, and truly loves engaging with customers. The red velvet frappé is a go to! (Comment from Samuel Blackmon, friend of the site creator.)

Address: 201 W South Main St # A, Waxhaw, NC 28173

Description: The only home town coffee company in landis. We love serving good organic coffee. We serve a unique line of pastries and yummy gluten free options as well. Our best sellers are the Willowbrook latte, Vanilla Caramel Latte, and the Coffee United. Use our menu link to order online for an easy pick up on the go or sit and stay with us. Sip from our custom unique in house cups and shop our plant bar selections!!

Veni Vidi Vici is a welcoming café where fresh coffee, soothing teas, and delicious baked goods come together in a cozy, community-focused space. Whether you're meeting friends or enjoying a quiet moment, every sip and bite is crafted to brighten your day.
Comments: The kind of spot that makes you feel at home the second you walk in. It's set in a converted house, cozy, super chill, and perfect whether you're getting work done, catching up with a friend, or just existing for a bit. The owner is incredibly welcoming, and you can tell he knows his regulars by name. The coffee hits (or so I've been told, I'm a tea drinker, and they have that as well), and the baked goods are fire. I haven't seen cinnamon rolls, but the range of pastries more than makes up for it. The banana nut bread and red velvet cookies are 🔥. They've also got fun drink options like the frozen hot chocolate and the Milky Way coffee if you're into sweet treats. Free Wi-Fi, soft lighting, mellow playlist, covered outdoor seating for hot summer days, and good vibes all around.

The aesthetic is very much "this used to be a factory." Wooden floors, brick walls, and loud and proud patriotism, definitely a great place to hit up on the Fourth of July. They don't have actual cinnamon rolls, but they do have a cinnamon roll-inspired coffee, which some folks (not me) might argue is even better. Most of the seating is at high tables, with a few spots by the window. There's not a ton of indoor seating, but plenty outside, so on warm days that's no issue. Outlet access indoors is excellent. It's right in the heart of downtown Kannapolis, surrounded by cool shops and local attractions. Great date spot. You can walk over to The Spice and Tea Exchange, one of my favorite places in the region for every kind of herbal tea imaginable (I'm a tea person). There's also a ballpark nearby if you're into baseball, or you can just stroll the row of shops outside. A great hangout if you're tired of Charlotte's "everything is new and pristine and nothing feels lived in" aesthetic. Downtown Kannapolis still has that small-town, mom-and-pop charm, and I love that.

Description:
Editions Coffee Shop & Bookstore is a cozy haven where literature and caffeine connoisseurs come together. As you step inside, the aroma of freshly brewed coffee mingles with the scent of well-loved books, creating an inviting atmosphere that sparks creativity and relaxation.

The space is adorned with shelves stacked high with a curated selection of both new releases and timeless classics, inviting patrons to explore literary worlds while savoring a cup of their favorite brew. You can also find a selection of gently used books!

The coffee offerings are equally enticing, with expertly crafted espresso drinks, teas, and Lotus Energy drinks!
Comments: I love this place. It's exactly what the name suggests, a coffee shop and a bookstore, but inside a converted house. I already love libraries and bookstores in general, but this one adds a full coffee shop while still keeping that traditional bookstore vibe, not the chic, trendy setup you get at Barnes & Noble these days. You'll see writing groups meeting to share their latest work, book clubs gathering, friends chatting, students doing homework, and people on their own reading, working, or browsing the shelves. I wish I lived closer so I could go more often. There's great access to outlets at the seating spots near the windows, and they even put sticky notes with the Wi-Fi info nearby, which I appreciate. There's a certain seat where you can see the road to your left and the train tracks to your right, so you can watch cars and trains go by. Main character, "my life is a movie" energy. Books are everywhere. They've made smart use of the space. Even when it's busy, if you peek around, you can usually find a place to sit. And while it's a coffee shop, they have an expansive tea menu. They've got a whole range of flavors, hot or cold. The respect for tea lovers is real 👏🏾💯. If you've ever been to Brakeman's in Matthews or Backyard Brew in Dilworth, also coffee shops in converted homes, it's like that but bigger and with a bookstore. There's plenty of parking, but just a heads-up, the entrance is a bit up the road across from the church. The road in front of the store that looks like the entrance is actually the exit.

Description: French Express Coffee House offers a variety of coffee, smoothies, and pastries. Known for its friendly staff and cozy atmosphere, it also features a convenient drive-thru. A local favorite for quality drinks and a welcoming environment.
Comments: Very friendly staff and a cozy, quaint, and inviting atmosphere. The concrete floors, corrugated metal paneling, and visible brewing setup give it a working, functional, industrial DIY sort of vibe. It's a smaller spot with just a handful of seating options, including a few four-person tables, some sofas, and a row of high chairs along a table by the window. Dog-friendly and has a drive-thru, which is a nice bonus.

Description: Lively indoor market hosting local shops, bars, bakeries & a variety of counter-serve eateries.
Comments: This spot includes a Not Just Coffee, Resident Culture, free Wi-Fi, plenty of seating, and lots of cool food stalls. It has an industrial chic vibe and is super trendy, from the decor to the music. The space is large and open, with all the seating positioned centrally while people walk about on both sides. That layout gives it an energetic feel, but not a relaxing one. Definitely not cozy. If you're easily distracted by movement, this might not be the spot for you, as there's nowhere to sit without people constantly walking by in your view. But if you like people watching, you'll love it here. Geno D's Pizza is great, and the overall setup is ideal for groups. Most of the seating is at large tables built for six or more, so it's a perfect hangout spot if you're rolling deep. And if you're not staying long, they have free 2-hour validated parking.

Description: A unique coffee shop nestled within a historic funeral home, offering a cozy atmosphere with a variety of specialty drinks and baked goods.
Comments: Concrete floors, metal chairs, exposed lighting, and corrugated metal along the counter give this place a distinct urban industrial vibe. It's a small spot, just a few tables inside and a couple more outside, but what makes it unique is that it's attached to a funeral home. The name "Coffin House" is quite literal. I felt surprisingly cozy here. Genuinely at ease. I don't know if it's a spiritual kind of calm that comes from being next to a funeral home, like that quiet stillness before death, which might actually be a little concerning if that's the case, or if it's just the warm decor and kind staff. Either way, this is a cool spot worth visiting.

Description: Trope Bookshop is Charlotte's cozy, romance-exclusive literary haven, beautifully designed with a moody, English pub-inspired atmosphere. With over 900 romance titles across thoughtfully curated sections, including romantasy, banned books, and local authors, it’s an ideal spot for discovering your next favorite read. It's not just a bookstore; it’s a thriving community hub with an engaging book club and friendly, passionate staff.

At Mattie Ruth’s our mission is for every individual who walks in both new and regular customers, to leave as happy with their experience as they are with their coffee. We strive to make the space and community just as important as the coffee.
Comments: Has a rustic cabin aesthetic, down to the scent, coffee mixed with a woodsy aroma that feels warm and authentic. Wooden chairs, cowhide rugs, plenty of art on the walls, Bohemian vibes, and reading lamps scattered across tables. Someone put real care into this space, and it shows. More than anything, though, I have to praise the cinnamon rolls they get from Honeybear Bake Shop in Charlotte. They have cream cheese frosting with a hint of maple flavor that seeps perfectly into the roll. As a self-proclaimed cinnamon roll connoisseur, it's fantastic. The sheer size combined with the standout frosting puts it on another level. Cream cheese frosting is famously difficult to get right on cinnamon rolls, so the quality of this one is all the more impressive. Until the day I had this cinnamon roll, I was convinced Sunflour Bakery had the best in greater Charlotte. Now I’m in doubt. Honeybear Bake Shop is serious business, and Mattie Ruth’s is blessed for carrying their rolls. This is a cool area in general. Gibson Mill Market is right across the street, which is similar to Optimist Hall but with a more relaxed "friends and family" vibe rather than the increasingly crowded, pretentious, "we have a huge lot, but you have to pay for parking now," trendy TikTok influencer vibe that Optimist has drifted toward 😞.

Address: 1115 Old Charlotte Rd SW, Concord, NC 28027
Description: Craft Coffee House with a mission to create an inclusive, community serving environment.

Welcome to Kunu Coffee Huntersville, a specialty coffee bar located just inside Lake Forest Huntersville. We're here to spread positive vibes around Lake Norman, NC through artisanal coffee and tea. Our baristas make every drink with precision, using only the highest quality, ethically-sourced beans, locally sourced A2 milks and organic syrups.
Whether you're working remote or need a place to bring the kids, Kunu Coffee is your go-to spot to jump start your weekday morning or brighten up your weekend. Order ahead on the app to skip the line and have your order ready for pickup.

Welcome to Kunu Coffee Cornelius, your go-to Cornelius neighborhood cafe. We're here to spread positive vibes around Lake Norman, NC through artisanal coffee and tea. Our baristas make every drink with precision, using only the highest quality, ethically-sourced beans, locally sourced A2 milk and organic syrups. Located on West Catawba in the heart of Cornelius, NC. Whether you're working remote or need a place to bring the kids, our Cornelius cafe swing by for a coffee to start your weekday morning or brighten up your weekend.

Welcome to Kunu Coffee Concord, a specialty coffee bar located just inside Gibson Mill Market. We're here to spread positive vibes around Lake Norman, NC through artisanal coffee and tea. Our baristas make every drink with precision, using only the highest quality, ethically-sourced beans, locally sourced A2 milks and organic syrups.

Gibson Mill Market is Concord's top community-driven gathering spot with a locally sourced food hall, craft breweries, and, of course, coffee! Whether you're working remote or need a place to bring the kids, our Concord is your go-to spot to start your weekday morning or brighten up your weekend.
Comments: This is inside Gibson Mill Market, which is a third place itself with plenty to do. I don’t drink coffee, but I asked a few people who have tried it here, and they rate it highly. The staff is super nice, they offer tea (my preferred hot drink) as well as coffee, and they have some pastry options, including cinnamon rolls 👏🏾❤️.

Address: 305 McGill Ave NW Bldg. 200, Concord, NC 28027
Description: Gibson Mill Market is a locally-sourced food hall located on the campus of historic Gibson Mill in Concord, NC.
Comments: Similar to Optimist Hall, but I like this spot way more. It's two stories with fewer stalls, which makes it feel more intimate and less overwhelming. Parking is plentiful and free, and it has a down-to-earth vibe rather than the trendy "you have to try this omg" TikTok energy Optimist has these days. The market itself is a third place, but within it, you've got Luck Factory Games on the lower level with its own café, board games, bar, and snacks. Then there's Kunu Coffee Co., and if that's not enough, you can walk across the street to Mattie Ruth's Coffee. If you make the drive out here, it's worth it. You can hang out all day, grab food, coffee, or tea, relax for a bit, and if you're into it, grab a drink at High Branch Brewing Co., which is on the lower level. It's busy enough on weekends to have good energy, but it never feels crowded, and I love that. This place is awesome.

Address: 305 McGill Ave NW Suite 80, Concord, NC 28027
Description: Luck Factory Games is a board game cafe featuring more than 1,000 board games of all kinds. We serve light bites, desserts, snacks and beverages (including sodas, tea, craft beers, ciders and wine) for customers to enjoy while they play and relax.
Comments: If board games are your thing, you will love this place. It's inside the already huge Gibson Mill Market, yet they've carved out a dedicated gaming space that's plenty large on its own. They have their own café with drinks, food, snacks, and every board game you can imagine. You can stop by just to hang out or check their website for opportunities to join meetups or reserve their event space. I love seeing people create spaces like this, fully dedicated to their "thing." We have a brewery on every corner in greater Charlotte, so I'm overjoyed to see this board game café put effort into being a cozy hangout spot.

Description: Cafe featuring coffee, food and pastries made fresh daily.
Comments: If you've ever seen The Good Place or Bruce Almighty, this feels like a coffee shop straight out of their versions of heaven. It's so bright, pure-looking, and impeccably clean that it goes beyond the typical modern coffee shop aesthetic. It's as if someone deliberately designed it to resemble a café in heaven, or at least how heaven is often portrayed in movies and TV. The atmosphere is calming, and the space is airy, it doesn't feel like everyone is on top of each other. Outlet access is fantastic. I'm pretty sure you can charge your device from almost every single seat inside. But here's what really won me over. The men's restroom has complimentary mouthwash, Q-tips, band-aids, lotion, a lint roller, and body spray. As a man, I've spent a lifetime accepting that men's restrooms are usually borderline post-apocalyptic, while women's restrooms typically have luxury touches to them. This place actually cares about the men’s restroom experience, and I respect that. We deserve it Kings 👑.

Description: Espresso drinks, light fare & sweet treats offered in a modern, laid-back space with patio seating.
Comments: They've got a lot more than just coffee. Tea, sandwiches, ice cream, pastries, smoothies, and bagels, to name a few. The seating layout is cozy, with enough space to feel confident about finding a spot on most days. It's tucked along the sides, so you always have a wall nearby to anchor you. Sitting in a spot with open space on all four sides can feel weird. Having a wall nearby somehow feels safer, and here, every seat is by a wall, which is nice. The atmosphere is relaxed. Dim lighting, some sofa seating, a covered outdoor area, and a great Christian music playlist in the background. Great spot, popular with Harrisburg locals.

Description: Monarch Market is a destination for crafted culinary experiences in the center of Uptown Charlotte featuring 13 vendors, 1 full-service restaurant, 3 bars and private event space.
Comments: A swanky spot inside One Independence Center with plenty of seating, a wide range of food options, and Wi-Fi (just ask a staff member for the password). It’s internally connected to Coco and the Director and the Marriott hotel, giving you even more seating and coffee options, just walk down the long hallway toward the reception desk to find it. There’s also plenty of outdoor seating. Popular with bank workers in the area.

If you're a tea person like me, you'll love this spot. They have plenty of options that go far beyond the usual office kitchen Bigelow teas. Try the Aurora Blue, it's fantastic. This spot shares a space with Alongside Brewing, operating as a coffee shop during the day and a brewery in the evenings. It has that classic brewery aesthetic. Unfinished floors, large communal tables that seat six or more, and an industrial vibe, but with more plants than most breweries, giving it a softer, more inviting feel. The space is well-designed, with good outlet access and plenty of seating. Parking can be tricky. The gravel lot only fits a few cars, and after that, you're competing with the nearby apartment building for street parking. But this place is cool enough (especially for tea lovers) that it's worth waking up early to grab a spot. A great place to read, study, or work during the day, usually not overwhelmingly busy, and they have some comfy sofas too.

Description:
Sustainability is the driver and focus of our coffee concept. Quality, ethical sourcing, and flavor are the criteria we search for when identifying local roasters to source our coffee beans. Featuring carefully curated coffee, tea, and juices, our expansive menu is reflective of the never-ending search for rich flavors and uncompromising quality. Our goal is to foster a community network of local business where people can develop an appreciation for local products. Choosing local roasters supports our community and guarantees the quality and freshness of our menu items.

There’s something special about the ritual of grabbing a fresh cup of coffee to get your day started or catching up with friends in our beloved Community.
Comments: Small, compact interior with some outdoor seating for extra options. It has that modern coffee shop aesthetic. Pristine and bright, with white floors and walls accented by pops of black. They offer a few cool cookie and pastry options alongside coffee and tea. Behind the counter, a short hallway leads to a cozy pair of sofas by a window, a great spot to relax and watch the cars go by. It's also a solid choice for a date since it's tucked behind a wall, giving you a little privacy, just the two of you 👀. They serve Rishi tea, which is top-tier as far as bagged teas go. I should mention that despite running this website, which aims to list nearly every coffee shop in Charlotte (since most are third places), I don't actually drink coffee. I'm a tea guy. So I can't tell you how the coffee is, but the vibes are 🔥.

Description: Nestled in the heart of Charlotte, NC, Gotcha Matcha & Espresso is not just your average coffee shop; it's a haven for those seeking a delightful blend of traditional and modern coffee and tea creations. Our passion for quality, creativity, and commitment to serving the finest beverages sets us apart as a unique and inviting destination for caffeine aficionados and tea enthusiasts. Our coffee shop's menu is a fusion of classic and innovative flavors. From rich, handcrafted espresso beverages to vibrant and earthy matcha concoctions, there's something to please every palate.
Comments: Small spot inside a larger building that houses other businesses as well. Within its section and the building at large, there’s enough seating to feel reasonably confident of snagging a spot. In the heart of Uptown, so paid parking, but plenty to explore. Worth an Uptown day trip, make this one of several stops in the area!

Address: 917 Central Ave unit b, Charlotte, NC 28204
Description: Local Eastern Cafe located inside SipCity! We offer quality house made syrups, food and good vibes. We have plenty of room with comfortable couches, FREE WIFI. So, come in for your Daily Ritual! See you soon Cheers!
Comments: Turn into the lot next to Two Scoops Creamery for parking, spots are limited though. The coffee shop shares the space with Sip City Market & Bottle Shop, but its signage isn’t super visible from the road. Look for the Two Scoops or Sip City signs, that’s your cue for Daily Ritual. Inside, there’s plenty of space, plus a bit more seating outside toward the back. The vibe is creative and cozy, like a mini art gallery, with paintings from local artists on the walls and various card games on the tables. Most of the seating is four-person tables, but there are comfy couches mixed in. Good outlet access, and good tea options, including pure Japanese matcha. It’s right across the street from Central Coffee, a Charlotte staple that’s fantastic but super small. If you’re in the area and need more space, this is a great alternative.

Description: A Cause for Tea is a tea house and fundraising initiative that empowers women and children worldwide, demonstrating God’s love one teacup at a time. We support nonprofits like New Life Nicaragua and HELP Pregnancy Resource Center, working with local leaders to provide advocacy, training, and resources to break the cycle of poverty.
Comments: As a tea lover, I was elated (SAT vocab out here 💪🏾) to find this spot. It's a charming tea house, set in a beautifully decorated historic home, with a blend of Southern charm and English tea traditions. It has a cozy and inviting atmosphere, with mismatched China and a vast selection of teas. It's best to visit during off-peak hours to avoid long wait times, as it can get quite busy, especially on weekends. Try the scones, chicken pot pie, and the resplendent (💪🏾) cherry almond tea. It's absolutely worth the drive from Charlotte if you're into tea, just get there early on the weekends. They also have a great missions as a business, check out their website for more details.

Description: KB’s Coffee is located just off of Hwy 74 and offers a large selection of specialty coffee and drinks! Hungry for a muffin or pastry? We have that too! Stop by and see us, you will be glad you did.
Comments: A quintessential cozy community coffee shop. In addition to coffee, they have plenty of pastries, including cinnamon rolls from time to time 🔥🙌🏾. On weekends, you’ll find groups of women who look like they could’ve been cast in Steel Magnolias hanging out here. The church aunties. The community grandmas. This is their go-to spot, and it’s an excellent choice. Good coffee, great pastries, comfortable chairs, warm lighting, and enough space to find a corner for a private conversation. A third place indeed.

Description: Beer , wine, espresso, snacks, toys and fun!! A gathering place for everyone.
Comments: If you’ve ever been to Common Market, this has the same vibe. A deli with convenience store options and a bar. It even shares a similar punk rock aesthetic, complete with an excellent playlist, cool stickers, and eclectic art throughout. There’s plenty of seating both indoors and outdoors, but outlet access is limited, so come charged up. The food is good, with interesting sandwich options, even down to their names. Wi-Fi is available, the info is posted on a small sign above the trash can near the nonalcoholic drinks case, or you can just ask the staff. If you’re making the trip from Charlotte, take some time to explore Monroe. This spot is in their downtown, which is highly walkable and full of interesting places to check out.

Description: Sorella Coffee is located in Historic Downtown Monroe. Serving Craft Coffee, Pastries, and Housemade Syrups.
Comments: Lively and bright atmosphere. White walls and furniture with pink accents here and there, plus an unfinished floor, giving it a stylish yet approachable feel. Very TikTok influencer-friendly. There's a spacious upstairs area with excellent outlet access. It turns into a pop-up shop for local businesses on weekends, so you can browse while you sip your coffee. The shop is in downtown Monroe, a highly walkable area with plenty to explore. A local I met during my visit highly recommended Main Street Bistro next door, as well as Oasis Sandwich Shop across the street, known for their hot dogs and cash-only policy. Parking is free in the city lot down the street, though there are some day and time restrictions depending on when you visit.

Description: High Octane Coffee Creamery Eatery is the newest Union County’s Newest and Hottest Foodie Location. Offers 100% Specialty Colombian Coffee, Hersheys Ice Cream, Sandwiches, pastries, smoothies,parfaits and acai bowls.
Comments: The name comes from the building’s history as an old gas station, and with it comes a repurposed industrial aesthetic. Not industrial chic, just straight-up industrial, with everything needed to run a coffee shop, bakery, and ice cream shop all in one. The bakery has cinnamon rolls🔥🙌🏾. And they're of a quality rivaling some of the regions best. It’s a large, generously iced masterpiece with frosting that somehow tastes like vanilla ice cream. I don’t know how they did it, but I’ve never had anything like it. And because of that, it’s just as good cold as it is warm. Ingenious. Bravo to the baker. There’s a moderate amount of indoor seating, but if you can’t snag a spot, there’s lots outside too. On weekends, a pop-up boutique sets up outside, selling clothes and various trinkets.

Description: We may not be a big fancy coffee house but we have a lot of love and compassion for our customers and community. Alice Jules coffeehouse “Where the coffee is brewed especially for YOU”
Comments: This is in a house with an English countryside aesthetic to it. Exceptionally cozy, comfortable chairs, dim lighting, a royal maroon color on the walls, vases on the countertops, art all about, and I’m not sure if it’s incense, a candle, or their coffee, but the whole place smells marvelous. Small interior but there’s plenty of outdoor seating, with more a very short walk away at Gateway Park. Great place to grab a coffee then sit outside on a warm day. There’s also an antique store right by it that has some interesting finds. It’s a cool area in general, far from cookie-cutter.

Address: 4705 Indian Trail Fairview Rd, Indian Trail, NC 28079
Description: Here at Rockhounds Coffee, our goal is to introduce great-tasting, locally roasted coffee to the Ice Rink! Come check it out on weekend mornings!
Comments: This spot is inside Extreme Ice Center, even if nothing outside hints at that, you're in the right place. When you enter, make a right and walk down the hallway past the vending machines. You’ll find the coffee shop set up as a concession-style stand just before the restrooms. It’s a legit standalone coffee shop, just tucked inside a larger arena. The shop itself is small, but the building is huge, with plenty of space to explore, sit, and spread out. There’s a pub upstairs (stairs are on the opposite end of the building from the coffee shop) serving food, drinks, and all the usual pub fare, plus a golf simulator up there as well. A hidden gem. Free Wi-Fi, free parking, small coffee shop, but a massive space. The only catch is checking the center’s schedule. Saturdays are packed with hockey games, making it a rough day to visit. But when there’s no game, this spot is cool.

Description:
Mado Paris – Authentic French Bakery & Cafe in Rock Hill, SC (Charlotte, NC Area)

At Mado, everything is homemade from scratch. We bring the true taste of France to the Carolinas with authentic French pastries, artisan breads, and specialty drinks.

🍰 Desserts & Pastries: Tarts, choux, and entremets, perfect for a sweet treat or celebration.
🥐 Viennoiseries: Buttery croissants (classic, chocolate, almond, apple… and more).
🍞 Artisan Breads: Sourdough baguettes, brioche, and savory bread, made with traditional French flour.
☕ Drinks: espresso, flavored lattes, cold-pressed French juices.

🏙️ Perfect for a coffee date, business meeting, or fresh-baked bread to take home.

📍 Rock Hill, SC | Serving the Charlotte, NC area
Comments: A French bakery that, to me, feels closer to authentic French pastries than our beloved Charlotte staple, Amélie's. The croissants, in particular, are incredibly buttery, flaky, and just downright good. No cinnamon rolls, but to be fair, they’re not a traditional French pastry. They’re staying authentic, and I respect that. The space has a rustic aesthetic, featuring a fireplace and a massive vault door that I can only assume was once part of a bank. Now, it houses a pair of couches and a coffee table. An interesting touch for sure. Compared to Charlotte’s more ritzy, modern cafés, this one feels refreshingly down-to-earth, in the best way possible.

Description: Borboleta Café is a vibrant, community-focused coffee shop located in the heart of Rock Hill, SC. Our mission is to create a welcoming, safe space where coffee lovers can connect, grow, and be inspired. We proudly serve high-quality, locally roasted coffee from Pure Intentions and offer a menu full of carefully crafted espresso drinks, teas, fresh pastries, and more. Whether you're looking to fuel your day with a delicious cup of coffee, attend one of our financial literacy workshops, or simply enjoy a cozy corner to relax- Borboleta Café is here to nourish your body and mind.
Comments: Tropical aesthetic with plenty of plants, both real and painted on the walls. Bright and energetic vibe, making it a solid spot for working, studying, and staying awake. There’s a moderate amount of seating. Not a lot, but enough that you can feel reasonably confident about finding a spot if you go during a non-peak time. But most importantly, they have cinnamon rolls 🔥💯. And not just any cinnamon rolls. These are sourdough-based with cream cheese frosting. I believe they’re from a local bakery, and they’re good. Surprisingly, they taste better cold than warm, though they’re great either way. Cream cheese frosting tends to struggle with heat. It’s a delicate science to get the right temperature without it melting into a soupy mess on the plate. Anyways, great spot.

Address: 1177 Stonecrest Blvd Suite 104, Tega Cay, SC 29708
Description: Tega Cay Coffee Company is open for business! We are happy to announce our storefront at 1177 Stonecrest Blvd - We look forward to serving you the absolute best coffee around!
Comments: Modern cabin aesthetic with good outlet access. It’s small, so it can feel cramped when it gets super busy, but on weekdays, it’s usually not overwhelming. Solid breakfast food. It's next to a nicer Walmart, as far as Walmart's go, so easy anxiety-free shopping is just around the corner after hanging out here.

Description: Welcome to Vavela Cafe! We are a Turkish style coffee shop located in Charlotte, NC. Our coffee is brewed using the traditional Turkish method, which results in a rich and flavorful cup of coffee. We only use the highest quality beans, and our coffee is always fresh and delicious.
Comments: One of Charlotte's most beautiful coffee shops. If you've been to Haraz or Qahwah House, it's similar, but in my opinion, better than both, in terms of design, not the coffee. The decor is fully Turkish/Middle Eastern-inspired, with golden accents, vibrant colors, plants scattered throughout, and hanging bookshelves adorning the ceilings on the far ends. The walls are covered with emblems and engravings, there's a spacious patio in addition to a spacious indoor area. There's also a coffee bean tree-looking centerpiece that looks cool. They serve coffee, tea, food, pastries, and some seriously good cheesecake. The two long tables inside offer good access to outlets, but the seating can be awkward. The chairs are tightly packed near the plants, making it difficult to reach your seat without stepping over others unless you're seated at the ends. But there's no way the owners of Haraz, Coffee Origin, and Qahwah House don't know about this place, because they're clearly all competing for the best Middle Eastern-style café in Charlotte. And as far as aesthetics go? I think this one wins.

Description: Casual, counter-serve outpost offering sandwiches & desserts plus bubble tea drinks in many flavors.
Comments: Lovely calming atmosphere, bright and floral aesthetic, great background music, friendly staff, unique bubble tea options and food. It's right by Vavela Cafe, which is amazing aesthetically, so definitely check that out as well.

Place: Charlotte Mecklenburg Library | University City Regional
Address: 5528 Waters Edge Village Drive, Charlotte, NC 28262
Description: Charlotte Mecklenburg Library is the library system serving Mecklenburg County, NC with 20 locations and a digital online site. Our mission is to improve lives and build a stronger community. We create a community of readers and empower individuals.
Comments: New as of 2025 and gorgeous. Bright, open, and airy with wall-sized windows letting in tons of natural light. The second floor has a great views of the surrounding areas, plenty of seating with tons of outlets, and a good number of study rooms if you need quiet focus or a spot to take calls. You’ll see a lot of remote workers camped out on the second floor, while the first floor is more kid-focused, which works out perfectly. There’s plenty of space for everyone to enjoy without being on top of each other. Just an all-around beautiful library.

Description:
ONE CUP AT A TIME
☕️ Brewing daily 8am-6pm
〰️ Great coffee and Pastries
Comments: Has a cozy, upscale cabin sort of aesthetic. Along with the usual options, they serve Turkish, Vietnamese, and Cuban-style coffee, plus flavors like butterscotch, blueberry, amaretto, and butter pecan. A moderate amount of seating, but it's compact. If anyone's having a conversation, everyone can hear them, making noise cancelling headphones a must if you're looking to study/work. Lots of cool Christian-themed art and inspirational quotes on the walls. It strikes a balance between feeling like an authentic local coffee shop while still having a modern touch in its design. Great spot. If you visit, also check out New Asia Market around the corner. Inside, there’s a quality Chinese food spot, and the store is packed with snacks, candies, spices, teas, and specialty foods from various Asian cultures—some of which you won’t even find at Super G Mart. A true hidden gem!

Description:
Coming Soon!
Specialty coffee, local pastries, craft beer & wine.
Comments: The space has a sort of contemporary yet regal aesthetic to it. Teal walls with gold accents and warm colors on the furniture and decorations. It’s by an apartment complex, so while there’s free parking, the spots are almost always taken by residents. Paid street parking is available nearby though. There's a moderate amount of seating, including some outdoor options and a picnic table area belonging to the apartments but accessible to all. Summit Coffee is in general a great Charlotte local chain. They have a unique birthday cake cookie. It has frosting piled in the center rather than spread to the edges, so you have to eat your way to it, almost like a reward. They also offer more creative tea options than most coffee shops.

Address: 340 W Tremont Ave Suite 110, Charlotte, NC 28203
Description: Looking for a refreshing and delicious dining experience at a fun restaurant in Charlotte, NC? Look no further than The Co-Op Frosé & Eatery! Since 2012, we have been serving up 60 rotating frosé flavors, gourmet sandwiches and salads, and all the good vibes! Whether you're in the mood for a classic frosé or want to try one of our unique flavor creations, we have something to satisfy every palate. Our menu also features a variety of mouthwatering gourmet sandwiches and salads made with fresh, high-quality ingredients. Stop by for a meal that will leave you feeling satisfied and refreshed. We also offer catering options. Visit us today!
Comments: The aesthetic is pure “this would’ve been a great set for the Barbie  movie”.  Unapologetically feminine. In addition to sandwiches, they’re known for their Frosé, basically a slushie, but alcoholic (though they do have non-alcoholic options). They also serve coffee, tea, chips, and cold drinks, so a proper deli. There’s plenty of seating in the main area, plus more along the back wall with high tables and chairs. Outlet access is limited, so come charged up. Parking is free behind and along the sides of the building, but spots are limited. If you can't find one, paid street parking is available.

This is attached to a newer (as of 2025) apartment complex called Elan LoSo. It's giving "posh, elegant, modern". But say all those words in a French accent. A mix of crisp whites, natural greens with plants here and there, and gold accents on the light fixtures. Bravo to the interior designer of this place. The aesthetic is lovely. The upstairs area is part of the coffee shop, and it's a gem. It's small, only 3 seating options, but they've adorned the overhang with plants, there's a restroom, it's carpeted, and 2 of the 3 seating options have outlet access. The coziest of cozy nooks. If you can get an upstairs spot, good for you. Downstairs is nice as well, a few two-person tables, couches, and coffee bar seating with outlets. Parking is tight, it's around the corner in a garage, paid and 2-hour limited. But there's a few street spots (you'll have to parallel park) that are free and not time limited. They're usually taken by apartment residents though. Overall, a lovely coffee shop, just got to time your visit well. There's another Night Swim around the corner on Old Pineville Road that's bigger, so if you can't find a spot (or parking) here, mosey on over there.

Description: A family-run bakery founded by self-taught baker Cristina Rojas, also known as “The Batchmaker.” Inspired by her Honduran roots and a love for serving others, Cris crafts fresh cakes, brownies, cookies, and more—often paired with a cup of coffee sourced from her family’s farm. Drop by for a warm welcome, sweet treats, and a taste of home-baked goodness.
Comments: This comment is courtesy of a friend (shout out JL). Founded by a Honduran with a great story and a generous heart—they donate all leftover pastries to public servants like teachers, firefighters, and police. It’s small, dainty, and has a super feminine, dollhouse aesthetic with teacups galore. The coffee cake, Oreo cookies, and raisin cookies are all verified hits. Also, Platform Coffee + Kitchen is in the same area, giving you another solid third place within walking distance.

Address: 1031 Matthews-Mint Hill Rd Suite B, Matthews, NC 28105
Description: Locally owned café and coffee bar offering breakfast, lunch and custom crafted coffees in our relaxing dine-in space and outside patios. Our menu features made to order omelets, bagels, breakfast sandwiches, grain bowls, empanadas, burgers, wraps, and salads as well as vegetarian options and many café classics. Our espresso bar uses locally roasted, sustainably sourced beans from Magnolia Coffee in our Nitro, cold brew, specialty coffee drinks and retail whole bean coffees. We also serve protein shakes, frappes, smoothies, and fitness drinks. Are you looking to host an event or party? Come check out our venue spaces inside our café and neighboring co-work. We also offer full-service catering through our sister company TreeTop Catering.
Comments: The food here is great, the burgers, empanadas, and fries are all hits. The fries in particular are incredible, very crispy. Also, they at times provide two different cinnamon roll options, a butter cream icing and a traditional icing. Words can hardly express how deeply I appreciate that. I love this place. Seating is spread out, shouldn't be hard to find somewhere to sit even during peak hours, but access outlet can be challenging so come charged up.

Address: 1607 Montford Dr Suite C, Charlotte, NC 28209
Description: La Dolcekca Bakery Cafe offers fresh custom cakes, gourmet coffee, and all-day meals, with the Tres Leches pastry as a standout favorite. It's a warm, welcoming spot designed to be part of your daily routine.
Comments: Aesthetic looks straight out of the Barbie movie. Extremely well done, clearly a lot of thought put into it. The owner is a wonderfully kind woman who opened the spot in fulfillment of a lifelong dream. She’s into the science of baking, going through recipe after recipe to get things right. She’s the only baker in Charlotte I’ve seen wait to apply icing to a cinnamon roll until after purchase to ensure it doesn’t dry out. Attention to detail 💯.

They have some really cool plant work going inside. The food is really good, particularly the breakfast flatbread and chicken/bacon sandwich, but seriously all the food is good. The vibes are as well. Limited outlet access though so come charged up.

Address: 2023 Beatties Ford Rd Suite D, Charlotte, NC 28216
Description: Archive CLT is a Black owned book cafe in Charlotte NC. We offer local roasted coffee and espresso along with your favorite nostalgic books, magazines and relics.
Comments: You could drop this spot right into Brooklyn and it'd fit right in. It's black owned, black themed, and very cool. The walls are decked with black history, culture, art, and icons. There's a live DJ sometimes playing music Mos Def would approve of. You can catch a group of Bernie Mac/Cedric the Entertainer brand old heads in here on some weekends in barbershop mode, just chilling. If Dr. Umar (iykyk) ever came to Charlotte this is where he'd want to hang out. Its unapologetically black. It's worth visiting just for the vibes. If you haven't caught on by now I—the creator of this site—am black—and proud!

Description: A family-run, Black-owned coffee shop located in Uptown Charlotte’s Queen City Quarter. Serving coffee, specialty drinks, pastries, and light meals, it provides a welcoming space for people to gather and relax.
Comments: Great spot to grab some food/coffee, work, study, or just chill in a cozy environment. It has that true family vibe—don’t be surprised if the owner or a family member stops by for a friendly chat. The pastries, particularly the donuts, are incredible. That's because they source them from Beyond Amazing Donuts, another local black-owned business, and a favorite of mine (they have marvelous cinnamon rolls). That plus the laid-back atmosphere makes it a great place to hangout!

Description: Visart Cafe offers a variety of coffee drinks, sodas, beer, wine. We also have hot food, charcuterie boards, local pastries and more! The cafe includes a pet friendly garden and access to the Visart theater!
Comments: This place is so cool. Vintage vibes all around. It's attached to a video store that still sells VHS tapes, DVD's, and Blu Rays. The cafe is an extension of that, serving coffee, tea, hot food, pastries, and other snack like items. When you arrive, the big sign says "Visart Video" but that's not where you go in for the cafe. Go around the corner down the long walkway, you'll pass a bunch of tables and chairs. That's a good chunk of the seating, outside, but there’s additional seating indoors through a door you pass walking in. The indoor area has this dark room/film auteur sort of vibe. Movie posters all around, various art pieces, very cool. There's Wi-Fi it's just not named after the store, ask the staff for the details. This is a great place to hang out if it's warm, there’s outlets outdoors. It’s right by an awesome local bookstore, Book Buyers, so you can get your drinks, browse the video store, and then browse the book store, all within walking distance. The first time I visited, a dude had the indoors booked to propose to his girlfriend. She was elated, I suspect they met here. The ambience here is...lovely ❤️.

Description: At Platform Coffee, we're all about building community and creating connections. From your first interaction to your last sip, you'll feel the warmth and joy that great coffee can bring. With our roastery located right here on-site, we’re able to serve freshly roasted coffee with unmatched quality and care. Our passionate team is dedicated to genuine hospitality in a welcoming atmosphere like no other—come experience it for yourself!
Comments: They have cinnamon rolls sometimes 🔥. Parking can be tough during peak hours as there's a bunch of other businesses nearby. They've got some serious food options, so if you want a meal with your coffee/tea this is a good spot to hangout. Decent access to outlets if you sit on bench seating side. Very relaxed, bright, welcoming, atmosphere.

Place: Night Swim Coffee | Old Pineville Road
Comments: The cinnamon sugar bagel is very good, they give you a generous amount of cream cheese, almost too much, which is marvelous. They have a solid tea menu, not an overwhelming amount of choices, but the ones they have are a step above your standard tea options. If you order tea "for here," they serve it in a nice mug with a little glass pitcher for extra tea, a plate, and sometimes even a gold-colored spoon. Very quaint, very posh, very...demure?

Description: Contemporary spot serving high-end coffee drinks, plus tea & light fare like toasts & yogurt.
Comments: This has to be the biggest Not Just Coffee in the city. I grew up in Seattle, this spot reminds me of coffee shops over there. You've got a crowd of very cool looking young people, hipsters, and then your professionals, all on their laptops, working, drinking coffee, and pausing here and there to socialize. This is like the coffee shop capital of South End, it embodies the vibe of the neighborhood perfectly. I like the hot tea options they provide, more creative than your standard options.

Description: Our vision for Waterbean Coffee is to create an environment where we are more than just another coffee shop. We’d love for you to think of us as an extension of your home or business.
Comments: This used to be the beloved spot Unwind Tea & Coffee before it was bought by Waterbean. The new Waterbean opened in the Fall of 2022, and while it doesn't have the same decor as Unwind, it maintains the respect the former had for tea. They have a shelf with at least 20 tea options in small demo canisters that you can pick up and smell to make your choice. The interior setup makes great use of the space, plenty of spots for individual seating plus a few larger tables for groups. It's always weird sitting at a table meant for four when you're just there to study or work on your laptop alone. You won't have that problem here. Great access to outlets, big windows that let in a lot of light, and a really good sandwich called the Waterbean Special, try it! I'm a regular here, it's one of my favorite spots in the city.

Address: 11318 N Community House Rd #202, Charlotte, NC 28277
Description: In 2019, I started Millbridge Cake in my Waxhaw kitchen, creating fresh, less-sweet cakes and desserts like those I made for my family. After four years of word-of-mouth growth, I expanded into ‘Littl Madeleine,’ a charming Korean cafe offering madeleines, scones, cookies, cheesecakes, and other Korean treats. At Littl ♡ Madeleine, every madeleine, scone, cookie, and cake is crafted exclusively with organic flour, organic sugar, organic milk, organic honey, organic eggs, AA-grade butter, and pure heavy cream. We handcraft everything in small batches, ensuring it’s fresh and real, and only make what we truly love, so we can confidently recommend each item to our customers. Gratefully, Sadie
Comments: A standout among the many coffee shops and bakeries in Charlotte. While they don't have cinnamon rolls 😞, they have very unique cheesecakes that are worth trying. There always seems to be a few couples on dates here, and I can see why. It's got that cute, clean, minimalist aesthetic: all white with subtle pops of color, like a doctor's office but way cozier. The kind of interior that TikTok/Instagram influencers would love. It's also laptop friendly with solid outlet access and some small tables fit for one or two. I like that most of the seating is blocked by walls so that you can't see the order area. So when people are waiting in line, standing around, checking out the bakery, if you're seated you mostly can't see them. That's such a good interior design thing to me. Reducing visual clutter for guests that want to lounge about.

Address: 793 W Charlotte Ave, Mt Holly, NC 28120
Description: Nestled in the heart of the community, Passion’s Café & Pastry is a cozy haven where locals and visitors alike come together to enjoy freshly brewed coffee and delectable pastries.
Comments: You know that hot pink and green crochet hook they sell at Sally Beauty that hairdressers use for braids? The aesthetic here reminds me of that, like the colors match almost exactly. This comment might only make sense if you’re black lol. My Mom braided my sisters hair so I saw that crochet hook a lot, and had to go fetch it plenty of times. The actual store is small but nice, lots of food options, and pastries. I couldn’t find Wi-Fi during my brief visit, but ask the staff if you go, maybe they have it. If they do, let me know via the Contribute page.

They're known for their croissants so definitely get one if you go. Small spot, maybe not ideal for an extended stay, but perfect for grabbing a bite and relaxing a bit. The staff here is incredibly kind. A coworker of mine got into an accident right in front of the store, and they came out to check on them, made sure they were okay, and gave them a free box of pastries. Truly run by great people!

Description: SipCha is a locally owned bubble tea shop specializing in fresh fruit teas, premium bubble teas, and daily-made rolled ice creams. Enjoy a relaxed, welcoming environment perfect for chatting and unwinding with friends.
Comments: Great access to outlets, small but connected indoors to Tous les Jours so you’ve got more seating and pastry options nearby.

Address: 13880 E Independence Blvd, Indian Trail, NC 28079
Description: Counter-serve bakery/cafe chain serving sandwiches, salads & more, known for its bread & free WiFi.
Comments: It’s Panera bread, you know what it is. Whatever you may think of them, they’re consistent with designing their stores as friendly places to hang out a while.

Address: 133 Indian Trail Rd, Indian Trail, NC 28079
Description:
Raw Crunch and Coffee is a fun, family-owned coffee shop nestled in the heart of Indian Trail, NC. Our coffee and milks are all organic, including our house made syrups. We are the only coffee shop in the nation that is proudly free of "natural flavors"! We are also known for our gluten free French crepes and house made Raw Crunch® bars. Coffee in the front, Raw Crunch® bar factory in the back. Whether you're looking for a quick pick-me-up or a relaxing place to unwind, stop by and taste the difference. Lets bring real flavor back!
Thanks a Crunch,
Ross & Kathy
Comments: Stands out for having really healthy, organic, clean versions of everything you’d expect a coffee shop to have, plus food. Bright aesthetic, very good crepes, inviting atmosphere.

Address: 606 Indian Trail Road South, Indian Trail, NC 28079
Comments: Warm, chill vibes. There’s a digital fireplace that I think is cool, gives the place a relaxing homey feel to it. Pretty calm throughout the day, there’s a good group of regulars but not the overwhelming rush you get at spots closer to the city.

Description: Premium Organic Yemeni Coffee. Specialty High Quality Coffee Imported From Our Own Family Farms!
Comments: Pristine vibes, immaculate aesthetic, very bright and airy. If you’ve been to Haraz Coffee House, this place is similar, but a lot bigger. It’s Yemeni owned, so the culture, coffee, and aesthetic of the shop reflects that in a beautiful way. The Khaliat Nahal (Honeycomb Bread) is incredible, it's somehow not as sweet as you'd think, but just sweet enough. Limited access to outlets so come charged up if you’re looking to hangout a while.

Description: A slow moving Monday morning. A fast paced Wednesday lunch break. An easy and pleasant Saturday afternoon. No matter where you are in your week (or your day), you can count on Salted Melon to have exactly what you need, sometimes before you know you need it.
Comments: Coffee, tea, food, drinks, in a clean, bright, bubble gum sort of aesthetic space. Whoever designed the interior is good at designing interiors. My only criticism would be the limited access to outlets. The food is good, the staff is very nice. Free parking, but it can get tight during lunch hours.

Address: 100 W Worthington Ave Suite 107, Charlotte, NC 28203
Description: A slow moving Monday morning. A fast paced Wednesday lunch break. An easy and pleasant Saturday afternoon. No matter where you are in your week (or your day), you can count on Salted Melon to have exactly what you need, sometimes before you know you need it.
Comments: Cool spot with similar vibes to Rhino Market, coffee, tea, food, bar, bakery, convenience store, all in one. However, this spot leans into being a proper restaurant as well, having a seated section with wait staff, silverware, etc. Very clean, modern, bright aesthetic. They have cinnamon rolls 🔥💯 and other bakery items that they get from Amelie's. It's South End, so parking is tough. There are free options in the area if you drive around, but the garage attached to this spot is paid, and they don't validate parking. In their defense, South End is meant to be a walkable area. The idea is to take the light rail, walk around, shop, explore. So if you go, take some time to embrace a walkable Charlotte. There's all sorts of spots in this general area.

Description: Summit Coffee's flagship store in downtown Davidson, North Carolina, this cafe serves coffee roasted locally by Summit, plus in-house baked goods, beer and wine and more.
Comments: Lauded by locals for having a welcoming atmosphere, a community hub for the area. Plenty of seating, they have an upstairs area and a lot of outdoor space in addition to the main floor. Davidson is a college town so plenty of students and staff hangout here to study and work. They have this birthday cake looking cookie where they put the frosting in the middle and don't spread it around. It's almost like they want you to eat your way to the frosting. It's a good cookie. They have nice tea options in addition to coffee.

Description: Sunflour Baking Company is a local bakery with locations in Harrisburg and Charlotte. Founded in 2009, Harrisburg is the newest location to feature fresh made pastries, local brewed coffee, and a great place to meet or hang out. Come visit Sunflour Baking Company today.
Comments: This is the largest Sunflour Bakery I’ve been to, go through the opening on the far right when you walk in and there’s plenty seating. If you can’t find parking out front, drive to the street behind the building, there’s more there. Across all their locations, Sunflour Bakery has what I consider to be the best cinnamon rolls in Charlotte. The sandwiches are also good, I suggest the Sunny Special on a cheddar biscuit, it’s huge. They also serve Rishi teas, a standout as far as bagged teas go. The orange blossom green tea is 🤌🏾👏🏾. Now, nothing here is cheap. You'll get like 2 things and spend $20, but it all tastes good, so it's worth the splurge every once in a while.

Description: Coffee. Good coffee.
Comments: Literally a house, and a very cozy, quaint, homey one at that. Limited indoor seating but there’s more outside, including rocking chairs. Their espresso milkshakes are consistently called out in reviews as being good. They also offer pastries and local handmade products (gift shop style). They roast their own beans and have the tools on display inside the house, very cool set up. Great place to check out during a Waxhaw day trip.

Address: 5910 Waxhaw Hwy Suite D, Mineral Springs, NC 28108
Description: Locally owned and operated coffee shop with local baked goods.
Comments: Quiet and inviting atmosphere that features coffee but also pastries, and most importantly, cinnamon rolls (👏🔥). They open early and close in the afternoons, so if you’re making a day trip from Charlotte, get up on time. It’s worth the trip. Waxhaw is around the corner so you can explore that area as well.

Description: Coffee shop
Comments: In addition to food, pastries, drinks, tea, and standard coffee options, this place stands out for serving fresh Ethiopian coffee. If you’re into coffee, you should try it, Ethiopia is quite literally the birthplace of coffee. They have cinnamon rolls (💯🔥), and let you order them without icing, which is unique and a plus for those looking to indulge but skip a few calories. Very relaxed atmosphere. The space feels open, bright, modern, and clean—but not in that cookie-cutter, industrial-chic coffee shop way that’s become overdone. It’s got character of its own, with touches of Ethiopian culture throughout. Parking is a bit limited directly in front of the shop, but there’s free street parking nearby if you don’t mind a short walk.

A bakery, café, and coffee shop all in one. Reviews frequently mention the pastries, muffins, smoothies, and chicken salad sandwiches as being great. Kid-friendly atmosphere, they have a small play area. Also, they have cinnamon rolls 👏🔥.

Description: Upscale grocery store chain with an old-world vibe offers local produce, prepared eats, wine & more.
Comments: The store itself is large but the seating area is a small strip of tall chairs against a tall shelf like table running across the checkout area near the restrooms. There’s a microwave in the area to warm up food. Good low key spot in the sense that not many use the seating. Free Wi-Fi, access to everything sold in the store, not a bad setup at all.

Description: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.
Comments: This is one of those where they put some effort into the interior design to make it inviting and bright. Excellent access to outlets from seating positions along the windows and walls, and even at the big table in the middle. Sits in a large shopping park with plenty of other things to check out.
