Description: The Wandering Cup coffee shop serves locally roasted coffee and local baked goods, located inside of Alchemy Coworking. Proudly serving Night Swim Coffee.
Comments: A cozy storefront in downtown Gastonia, right in the heart of the old town, but with a fresh, modern vibe. Shares the space with Alchemy Coworking, who have plenty of additional seating, but require membership for access. The actual coffee shop's seating area is small but nice. Limited street parking right in front of the shop but there’s lots within walking distance. In addition to good coffee, the staff are known for being really nice here.

Description:
Take a step back in time and enjoy the relaxed shopping experience of the 1920’s General Store, and sit with friends at our cafe, or relax with a good book in a comfortable reading space. Enjoy free WiFi while you spend time with us. We will offer in-house roasted coffees, bulk coffees, teas, spices, oils and vinegars.
Our cafe will offer specialty coffees, teas, soft drinks, and light snacks, such as pastries.
In addition, there are a variety of exclusive and reasonably priced items for your entire family.
We are open!!!
Stop by anytime and visit !
Comments: A gift shop, roastery, spice store, and coffee shop all in one. Rustic, cozy, vintage, is how I'd describe this place. Free Wi-Fi, decent access to outlets, and a good selection of coffee and tea. I'll admit, it took some convincing to get me out to Gastonia, but its got its own charm. Worth a day trip to the area, after stopping here, you can go shop at the nearby Dillard's Clearance Center (the deals are real) if you're looking to update your wardrobe.

Place: Seoul Food Meat Company | South End
Address: 1400 S Church St a, Charlotte, NC 28203
Description: A rustic hangout for Korean-inspired BBQ eats paired with Asian craft beers & custom cocktails.
Comments: Huge space, indoor and outdoor seating, plenty of food/drinks, and plenty to do, including karaoke. Parking is validated but you've got to download an app and get a code from a staff member (ask them for help if you're lost), and during peak hours it can be tough to find a spot. Seating next to outlets can be a challenge. The wings are really good here. Not social media hype good, I'm talking real life every day no hyperbole good.

A spacious, swanky atrium with marble floors, high ceilings, and plenty of natural light. It's connected to Bank of America, Blumenthal Performing Arts Center, and the Overstreet Mall. The 2024 redesign added tons of comfy seating and outlet towers so you can easily stay charged. There's several free Wi-Fi options (try another network if one acts up) and a Caribou Coffee for drinks and snacks. The downside is it's Uptown, so no free parking. I'd suggest parking in the Bank of America Corporate Center Garage—take the elevator to the 6th floor, and you’re inside Founders Hall. There's security guards everywhere, to the point where it's like "ayo calm down". They on every corner. You'll never feel safer than you will hanging out here. Upstairs near Caribou there’s a game room open to the public called The Lounge with ping pong, mini golf, a pool table, arcade games, and overpriced snacks. Around the corner from Caribou, you'll find a Post Office, a small library, and a path to the Overstreet Mall with more food options. You can explore most of Uptown indoors via the skywalks that connect the big buildings. This place is totally worth an Uptown day trip. Work/study then explore and go to an evening event (Hornets game, Middle C Jazz, Blumenthal show) to justify the price of parking.

Place: Seoul Food Meat Company | Mill District
Description: Southern BBQ and Korean fusion
Comments: Spacious with plenty of seating indoors and out. During the day, it’s easy to find a quiet corner. There’s a variety of food, drinks, desserts, and even an arcade with karaoke. The wings are seriously good. I'm not saying that flippantly they are actually really good. Right next to Urban District Market (same owners), it's a great remote work/study spot, though outlets are limited. The proximity (literally 30 second walk) makes it easy to switch between the two—park once, enjoy two solid options, both open late.

Description: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.
Comments: Very bright, large windows everywhere, lots of light to keep you energetic if you’re here to work or study. This is one of those with the big long table with outlets in the middle. Then there’s a handful of individual tables to the sides and lounge chairs. It’s in a large shopping complex in a rather ritzy part of town. There’s a Smashburger nearby 👀🔥. Do what you will with that information.

Description: Olive’s Clay Studio and Olive’s Coffee Shop are one and the same business. We are Coffee and Art Studio with Classes. Make an appoint today by email to talk to us!
Comments: Sits in the historic downtown area of Fort Mill. Eclectic vibes. There are shelves around the store with arts and crafts and various trinkets created by locals. There’s also a piano anyone is welcome to play. Locally owned, serves as a gathering place for various groups, such as ceramics and knitting enthusiasts. Pretty compact space but they waste none of it. There’s a string of chairs near the piano with outlet access for those bringing their laptop. There’s limited parking right in front, for additional options, park in the Fort Mill Municipal Parking Lot down the street at the stoplight. It’s a short walk to the coffee shop.

Address: 6840 Matthews-Mint Hill Rd, Mint Hill, NC 28227
Description: Charlotte Mecklenburg Library is the library system serving Mecklenburg County, NC with 20 locations and a digital online site. Our mission is to improve lives and build a stronger community. We create a community of readers and empower individuals.
Comments: Very nice, new, modern library. Moderate amount of seating, while the space itself, in terms of square footage, is about medium sized, the actual spots where adults (excluding the kids and teens zone) can sit down could be described as on the smaller side. Despite this, it’s a fine library, as is consistent across Charlotte-Mecklenburg branches.

Address: 900 S Fork Village Dr G4, Belmont, NC 28012
Description: Located in the South Fork Village apartment complex, serving specialty coffee along with locally made baked goods. Proudly serving Night Swim Coffee from Charlotte, N.C. Wander on over to see us soon!
Comments: In addition to coffee and pastries, they have a wonderful selection of teas from the family-owned and operated Piper & Leaf Tea Co in Alabama. Visit their website to learn more about their business story!

Description: As children of Vietnamese immigrant households, we have always been taught the value of food and its great meaning in our daily lives. Our love for Vietnamese cuisine is nurtured by time through the highs and the lows of our parents' cooking, which is why we founded 220C Banh Mi & Coffee as a place where everyone is welcome to hang out and enjoy Vietnamese food made with passion that is accumulated for many generations.
Comments: Small space but great aesthetic. The owners are Vietnamese so in addition to serving food, pastries, and coffee reflecting their culture, they’ve arranged the store the same. The sandwiches and pastries are really good. They have cinnamon rolls (💯🔥). They have hot or cold tea, the hot peach blossom is great. Limited access to outlets. The seating is compact, but it doesn’t get too crowded in the mornings, so come early to secure a spot.

Address: 104 W Charlotte Ave, Mt Holly, NC 28120
Comments: They have various pastries, sometimes cinnamon rolls, but the cream cheese Danish they have regularly is fire. Has a small town rustic coffee shop aesthetic that's delightful. You don't have to park on the street, there's a lot behind the building that's free.

Address: 613 S Main St A, Mt Holly, NC 28120
Description: Fresh coffee and pastries
Comments: The coffee shop is the door on the left when you enter. Lots of seating, also lots of outlets, all somehow placed in slightly inconvenient locations (look above and below the windows). But at least they're there! It's Yemeni owned, the walls are covered in very well done art representing their culture. I think this location used to be a video store, so they did a marvelous job converting the space. There’s Wi-Fi, the password is the name of the store all lowercase, no spaces, and no s at the end of origin. The cheesecakes they sell are all marvelous. They put some bakery level effort into those things.

Description:
The Everyday Market is a community-focused cafe that strives to create simple and delicious made-from-scratch food paired with exceptional coffee.
Taking inspiration from European cafes, The Everyday Market offers a space for the community near and far to relax and escape the hustle and bustle of everyday life.

The team, led by pastry chef / owner Majid Amoorpour, are happy to be part of Belmont’s historic downtown and would love for you to come spend some time with us.

The second Everyday Market location recently opened in the vibrant Lower South End district of Charlotte, NC.
Comments: Lots of food options, coffee, tea, pastries, and various market items for individual purchase. Parking is free but limited in terms of store dedicated spots. There’s additional Belmont downtown parking though. You might have to drive around a bit to find a spot if you go during peak hours, but Belmont is very walkable. I’d say walking around downtown Belmont to get here is a part of the attraction. There’s plenty of indoor and outdoor seating, although it’s popular enough to get crowded around lunch time. There’s a nice park and walking trail across the street. Limited access to outlets, but so long as you’re charged up, it’s a great place to hangout. Start here, eat, drink, then explore Belmont.

Description: The Everyday Market is a community-focused cafe that strives to create simple and delicious made-from-scratch food paired with exceptional coffee.
Comments: Food, coffee, tea, and pastries in a good sized space. Limited access to outlets though, and parking can be tough, really tough. It’s free street parking but there’s so many other businesses in the area and apartments making it challenging to find a nearby spot. It’s worth toughing out though, the foods good, the staff is kind, they have large windows that let in a lot of light. Cool spot.

Description: Long-running store selling & trading a wide, regularly changing selection of books.
Comments: My favorite bookstore in Charlotte. Lot's of space, older building that feels lived-in, authentic. It even smells like a bookstore, idk how it just does. A very expansive book selection, and random chairs in the various corners and crevices so you can sit and read. Awesome place. I wouldn’t suggest going here to work, it’s a proper bookstore, the seating is individual without outlet access or nearby tables. Embrace the book vibes. Read.

Description: Independent bookstore selling new & used books
Comments: The quintessential local bookstore. Connected indoors with Press & Porter Coffee, who in addition to great drinks, have cinnamon rolls 🔥💯.  Get a good book, grab a coffee, find a place to sit between the bookstore and coffee shop. Sounds like a good time to me, speaking from experience.

Description: Good energy, local coffee, craft beer, and CATS, right in the heart of two beautiful historic districts in North Carolina: NoDa, Charlotte and Downtown Concord! Twelve adoptable cats roam the CAT LOUNGE - and they are ready to play! Our CAFE is separate and offers coffee, wine, craft beer and more!
An independent bookstore in east Charlotte, offering a carefully curated selection of adult fiction and other genres.
Comments: Lovely little bookstore. Seating exists as a few tables and chairs by the front windows and a set of closely compacted couches. So not quite a remote work spot, but I encourage an embrace of literature. Leave your laptop behind and come here to read!

Description: International Food Hall
Comments: Adjacent to the Super G Mart in Pineville (they’re connected inside). Large space with lots of food stalls, similar to Optimist Hall and Urban District Market, except all the spots are Asian food/culture focused. You can get coffee/tea from Tous les Jours inside Super G Mart or from Honeycow inside the actual hall. They have QR codes on the walls that allow you to order from any place within for pick up. Plenty of places to sit down, outdoor patio, free Wi-Fi, but limited access to outlets, so if you bring a laptop, come charged up.

Description: Immerse yourself in the vibrant atmosphere of The Bowl at Ballantyne, a captivating destination where culinary delights, enriching experiences, and natural beauty converge. Stroll along the picturesque stream park, savor delectable flavors at a diverse array of eateries, and indulge in pampering services that elevate your every day. Discover a world of endless possibilities at The Bowl, where every moment is crafted to inspire and delight.
Comments: Fly Kid Fly and The Salty offer free Wi-Fi, coffee, and limited indoor seating. The whole area is an outdoor marketplace with plenty of seating, stores, and spots to hangout.

Address: 100 N Tryon St Suite 270, Charlotte, NC 28202
Description: Coffeehouse chain serving signature drinks, mochas & lattes, plus coffee & breakfast.
Comments: A great place to hangout enroute to exploring the Overstreet Mall. Work a bit from here, then hit the walkway around the corner (towards the post office and small library) to explore the rest of Uptown from indoors. Caribou has great sandwiches, and an extra large size for hot drinks that's larger than the Starbucks Venti. The tea's really good. This spot has limited inside seating, but there's a ton of seating outside in Founders Hall. This actual space is small, but the building its' in is huge. Founders Hall has a beautiful atrium and many seating options with great views of the city.

Description: Charlotte Mecklenburg Library is the library system serving Mecklenburg County, NC with 20 locations and a digital online site. Our mission is to improve lives and build a stronger community. We create a community of readers and empower individuals.
Comments: A small library with a big space for kids, limited general seating, but a nice space regardless. Very nice staff.

Description:
The Percantile and Creamery is the premier Coffee, Ice Cream, and Dessert Bar in the Charlotte metro area. We are thrilling people with our amazing interior design, our incredible customer service, and the quality of our offerings. We have a beautifully designed 1920’s Mercantile-themed monochromatic throwback, where people feel excited by their surroundings, and blown away by their treats. Great for business meetings, families, couples, and you! Ask us about room rentals for meetings, events, or parties! Now offering catering.
Nestled next to Concord Mills Mall, behind Verizon, and in the same building as McAlister’s in Concord, NC!
Comments: Beautifully designed interior. They have excellent tea options (Harney & Sons, one of the best around), coffee, and all sorts of sweet treats (their ice cream is particularly good).

Address: 8440 Pit Stop Ct NW #180, Concord, NC 28027
Description: A friendly and welcoming tabletop game store for enthusiasts and novices alike.
Comments: A community submission. Located in a strip mall adjacent to Concord Mills. They also have beer and wine, plus a small snack shop. Check their website for tournaments and events.

Description: Large supermarket chain with deli & bakery departments, plus health & beauty aids.
Comments: There's a Starbucks downstairs with a decent amount of seating, but what makes this a third place is the upstairs area with even more seating, a huge outdoor patio, and a bar. The outdoor patio is so large you can almost certainly always get a corner to yourself, but bring noise canceling headphones if you sit outside, it’s right above a busy street. The restrooms are upstairs making it convenient. Harris Teeter's is interesting in that some locations are just a grocery store, and others are like a grocery store and community hangout spot with a bar, hot food, Starbucks, plenty of seating, etc. This is the latter.

Address: 414 Tom Hall St, Fort Mill, SC 29715
Description:
We’re a local family-owned coffee shop nestled close to downtown Fort Mill, SC. We’re a local hangout spot where people could chill, work, and have meaningful conversations.
We’ve got a wide variety of drinks, from seasonal lattes to classic black coffee. We also offer a variety of loose leaf tea, Matcha & Chai. We also sell our freshly roasted coffee beans and delicious pastries from Whisk & Wood (Charlotte, NC) and Poppyseed Kitchen (Fort Mill, SC). We started roasting coffee in our garage back in 2019 and then expanded to selling at local farmers markets. Our coffee shop finally opened in 2023, and we’re thrilled to serve the greater Fort Mill community!
Comments: Good access to outlets along the wall. They have cinnamon rolls 👏🏾🔥. Modern coffee shop vibes in what looks like a converted space. There’s nice artwork on the walls from local artists you can buy to support them. They have unique tea options, the Organic Blue Ginger is particularly good.

Description: Food stalls, public art, shops & events in a complex once used as a car factory & military depot.
Comments: This is a large outdoor area with many indoor stores within its boundaries. You've got food, lot's of outdoor seating, outdoor Wi-Fi, Hex Coffee Shop on site if you want to chill indoors. There's all sorts of events happening here on a regular basis, check their website for more details.

Address: 6500 S New Hope Rd, Belmont, NC 28012
Description: The Trailhead Store is the on-site coffee house of the Daniel Stowe Conservancy, which does not require membership or admission to utilize. It includes upstairs working space and a covered screened in porch that is popular with remote workers seeking a change of pace from working from home. The Trailhead Store also often hosts events free to the public, such as our Pickin' on the Porch music series and outdoor yoga.
Comments: A community submission. Located within the grounds of the Daniel Stowe Conservancy. You can work/study then explore the gardens and hiking trails. All seating is outside in a covered patio and then various fully outdoor seating options around the store (including a nice gazebo) and throughout the grounds of the gardens. So, a great option for a warm day.

Address: 6500 S New Hope Rd, Belmont, NC 28012
Description: The Daniel Stowe Conservancy is a non-profit public garden with an on-site coffee house, the Trailhead Store, which does not require membership or admission to utilize. The Trailhead Store includes upstairs working space and a covered screened in porch that is popular with remote workers seeking a change of pace from working from home. The Trailhead Store also often hosts events free to the public, such as our Pickin' on the Porch music series and outdoor yoga. In the Garden we have many tables and areas you can work, relax, catch up with friends/family and enjoy the beautiful surroundings. We also have miles of trails on the property to enjoy which are also accessible without an admission fee.
Comments: A community submission. While the outdoor gardens themselves don't have Wi-Fi, the coffee shop on site called The Trailhead Store does. You can hangout from the shop, work, study, get something to drink, and then walk around the gardens. Sounds like a great day!

Address: 3701 N Davidson St Suite #203, Charlotte, NC 28205
Description: An arts-focused craft brewery, lounge and performance space. Plenty of room for working alone or sprawling with friends. In addition to beer, has a wide variety of alternative beverages including house-made alcohol free drinks like craft sodas and caffeinated hop water.
Comments: A community submission, they have cinnamon sugar pretzels, so not quite cinnamon rolls, but just about the next best thing!

Description: We are Belmont Bookshop, a community-focused bookshop and gathering space located on historic Main Street in Belmont, NC about 15 miles south of Charlotte in Gaston County. Come on in and stay a while!
Comments: A community submission. They have game nights, book clubs, space to hang out, coffee, alcohol, etc. It’s a proper small local bookstore, complete with the decor and trappings typically associated with such, as in it feels very authentic. The seating is mostly individual chairs interspersed throughout for easy sit & read access. There’s Wi-Fi but I think you’re better off enjoying the bookstore vibes here than trying to whip out your laptop and work (limited outlet access). There’s a lovely gentle dog that hangs around the shop sometimes as well. A good boy indeed.

Description: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.
Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.

Comments: This is the nicest Barnes & Noble in the Charlotte area. It's pristine. A rather large Starbucks seating section compared to other locations with excellent outlet access. The bookstore itself is well arranged so that genre areas feel tucked away in corners with random chairs here and there. Tall ceilings give the building an airy feel, even when busy, doesn't feel crowded. The location is convenient too, plenty of shopping to be had in Concord Mills after chilling here.

Description: Eco-minded chain with natural & organic grocery items, housewares & other products (most sell wine).

Place: The Holy Grind Coffee House of Kannapolis
Description: Our Kannapolis coffee shop offers customers a warm and relaxing atmosphere with uplifting music, along with quality coffees, smoothies, pastries, and more! It’s our passion to see people find rest, hope, and encouragement to make it through their day!

Address: 25 Barbrick Ave SW Ste. 103, Concord, NC 28025
Description: High Grounds Coffeehouse is a cozy, woman-owned coffee shop in downtown Concord, NC, known for its friendly staff, excellent coffee, and welcoming atmosphere. Customers love the flavorful lattes, great prices, and convenient parking options. It's a perfect spot for grab-and-go or a quiet place to study and relax.
Comments: Small but it’s walking distance from Goldberry Books and Press & Porter Coffee & Pourhouse, so you’ve got options. Nice spot if you like sitting by the window and watching the world go by. All seating has window watching access.

Description:
Provided Coffee Concord is a mega-cafe located next to Nothing New Vintage, behind Southern Strain Brewing. We are proud to be one of the largest coffee shops in NC! We serve an assortment of handcrafted espresso beverages and bottled drinks.

Founded by two best friends at 18 years old, Provided aims to create an atmosphere of community wherever travelled. As coffee can act as a bridge of connection between others, the customer can expect "special experiences in unusual places."
Comments: Huge space in a converted industrial building that’s shared with a thrift store. A quintessential example of the industrial chic aesthetic. I love it. The wooden floors creak as you walk around, there’s still a bit of that old building smell, very well done space. They managed to provide fairly good access to outlets with the redesign, although it’s not abundant, so charge your laptop before coming. Follow the signs if you’re struggling to find the entrance, it can get confusing as there’s also a brewery nearby.

Address: 3775 Concord Pkwy S Suite 116, Concord, NC 28027
Description: Your Neighborhood Coffee and Ice Cream shop. Serving Hot and Iced Coffee, 24 flavors of Herseys Ice Cream. Milkshakes, fresh bakery

Welcome to Coffee Republic Matthews, your go-to coffee shop since 2019! We serve roasted coffee, handcrafted drinks, and fresh bakery treats in a cozy shop. As passionate coffee roasters, we bring you the finest brews to fuel your day. Stop by today!
Comments: Small but nice spot. Most of the seating is bar style chairs across a shelf like table across a wall. The food is good. There’s a rather large Goodwill nearby so if you’re into thrifting you can make it a whole trip.

Description: Coffee Republic & Bakery is a charming establishment located in Cornelius, North Carolina. This bakery and coffee shop is a local favorite. It provides a cozy and welcoming atmosphere where customers can enjoy a wide range of treats and beverages.

Coffee Republic & Coworking – Huntersville is the best coffee shop near you for work and relaxation. Enjoy premium coffee, fresh pastries from our bakery, and a modern coworking space. Stay productive while savoring the best coffee in town!

A really cool coffee shop in old town Cornelius with a cozy local vibe. We serve locally roasted craft coffee and exotic loose leaf teas along with Breakfast and lunch fare made in house, and amazing scrumptious baked goods.
Comments: Lots of tea options, coffee, food, and pastries in a small but bright and inviting space. Good access to outlets, most seating along the walls can access some. Has all the menu options and amenities of trendy new age coffee shops but keeps the homey local spot decor and atmosphere. A very clean place. Great music, perhaps that’s just a coincidence related to the playlist selected by the staff when I visited, but it twas 🔥. It’s small enough that everyone can hear your conversation if you’ve got a strong voice, so don’t come here to discuss super secrets, but it’s an excellent choice for working, studying, reading, meeting friends, chilling, etc. If you fancy a walk, a very nice trail, the Antiquity Greenway, is right down the street. You can grab your drink and head outside to touch grass.

Address: 9705 Sam Furr Rd ste a, Huntersville, NC 28078
Description: Waterbean Coffee was the first specialty coffee shop in the Lake Norman area that offered pour-over, French Press, Aeropress, and over 5 different espresso single origin or blends for our customers to choose from.

Summit Coffee brings award-winning craft coffee to a beautifully designed café, highlighted by tons of outdoor seating and natural light. This family-friendly store features a full coffee and espresso bar, plus draft beer, wine, locally baked pastries and more.

Summit Coffee's Birkdale store will feature live music, other events and much more.
Upscale grocery store chain with an old-world vibe offers local produce, prepared eats, wine & more.
Comments: The seating section here is in a corner of the store by the checkout. This is a really nice neighborhood and fancy store, even fancier than Whole Foods. If you’ve ever been to Wegmans, it’s kind of on that level. The store itself is large but the seating section is medium sized. Free Wi-Fi, seating with good access to outlets, a microwave to warm up food you buy from the store, cinnamon rolls 🔥, restrooms right by the seating area, and coffee/tea (in front of the cold bistro meals case). This place is a low key gem.

Description: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.

Comments: There's parking right behind the building and more in a nearby garage that serves all businesses in the area. They have cinnamon rolls 🔥💯. Sort of a fancy cabin aesthetic to the place. Doesn’t feel crowded, there’s enough space to spread out and feel comfortable, particularly on warm days as there’s plenty of outdoor seating. The door in the back that leads to the restrooms also takes you to Goldberry Books, so you can grab a drink, pick up a book, and have plenty of seating options between the two places.

Description: More than 30 arcade games headline this modern spot serving craft beers, cocktails & sodas.

Comments: There's a free parking lot down the street by the Pineville Police Department building. You will find your people here if you’re into D&D, Warhammer 40k, Yu-Gi-Oh, and the like. The store has a Discord (link on their website) where they organize meet ups and games. You can book the space anytime as well if you are looking for a place to host a game. They sell snacks, drinks, and beer, and there’s restaurants across the street, so you can grab food, bring it in, and stay for a while.

Description: Heist Brewery and Barrel Arts is the second location for Charlotte based Heist Brewery. Featuring a spacious taproom that will be utilized to feature small batch barrel aged offerings, as well as primary brews such as CitraQuench'l and Blurred is the Word. We also are the home of Livy's Neapolitan Pizzeria, open every day that Barrel Arts is. Come enjoy a beer or two, grab a pizza, and relax.
Comments: Plenty of space to spread out and find your corner. Limited outlet though so come charged up.

Right across from a light rail stop, so easy access for those who live on the line and don’t want to drive here. It’s in the bottom of an apartment building, so plenty of traffic during peak hours. Parking is free if you can find a street spot, which might be tough given that  apartment residents and their guests usually have those spots. There’s a paid very small gravel lot nearby though. Excellent, like 10/10 Super Saiyan god level access to outlets. Very well designed. You can show up with your battery on E and you should be alright. The bagels are really good, and the hot tea options. I’m sure the coffee is as well, but I’m a tea guy.

They have a mini market with a good selection of Korean foods and candies. The owner of the market is Korean, so there’s some inspiration from his culture throughout the market. See if you can find the Ritz Crackers with cream between them (like an Oreo, but with Ritz) in the store. I promise it tastes better than it sounds. There’s a coffee shop within the market in addition to plenty of food stalls. The tables have outlets embedded into them so you can stay charged up. Fast free wifi, check the napkin holders for the password. Great remote work spot.

Description: Counter-serve bakery/cafe chain serving sandwiches, salads & more, known for its bread & free WiFi.
Comments: I think Panera is overpriced and the food is middling at best but the interior set up and organization as a place to read, study, or work remotely remains excellent across most all their locations, this one included. Also, they have cinnamon rolls, and they’re quite alright. This spot is plenty large. If you need a place to work or study, and want a guarantee of seating and good outlet access, this is a solid choice.

Address: 139 E Main St, Rock Hill, SC 29730
Description:
Coffee. Culture. Community.
Good because we care.
Cheery regional coffeehouse chain serving specialty drinks, smoothies & baked goods.
Comments: I’d say this is most similar to a small Caribou Coffee. Coffee, tea, food, pastries, and a drive thru. This location is new (as of 2024) and very clean as a result. Also, I'm like 70% sure they get their sandwiches from the same place as Caribou Coffee, they're great. Not a ton of seating, so if you drive here and can't find a spot, drive up the street to the Pineville Library or Waterbean Pineville for more options.

Address: 526 John Ross Pkwy Suite #101, Rock Hill, SC 29730
Description: Counter-serve bakery/cafe chain serving sandwiches, salads & more, known for its bread & free WiFi.
Comments: I think Panera is overpriced and the food is middling at best but the interior set up and organization as a place to read, study, or work remotely remains excellent across most all their locations, this one included. Also, they have cinnamon rolls, and they’re quite alright. Nothing remarkable, but certainly passable.

Address: 153 E White St, Rock Hill, SC 29730
Description: Community centered, family-owned, mercantile & café bar in Downtown Rock Hill, SC.
Comments: It's a massive general store full of cool trinkets, gifts, and a laid-back, folksy vibe. The kind of place you can wander through for a while and still find something new each time. Inside, there's also a coffee shop tucked into the corner, perfect for grabbing a drink while you browse. The whole area makes for a great day trip, with other spots like Knowledge Perk, Rock Hill Coffee, Amelie's Rock Hill, and plenty of local shops within walking distance. If you're looking to wind down, end your day at nearby Fountain Park with a good book and something warm to drink. You’ll feel like you’re in a movie, one of those they used to always cast Drew Barrymore in.

Place: Knowledge Perk Coffee Company | Fort Mill
Description:
Come relax in our beautiful café with indoor and outdoor seating. We offer freshly roasted coffee, cold brew, full range of expert espresso beverages, and a variety of sweet and savory pastries and bagel creations.

Thursday-Friday from 4:00pm-9:30pm, and Saturday from 6:00pm-9:30pm, we turn into Knowledge Perk "After Hours," serving coffee, original cocktails, beer, and wine.

We are a coffee roaster and beans are available onsite or via our website for retail purchase. We have immersive, engaging programs and events for our community to grow in their knowledge and enjoyment of coffee. Give us a call or visit our website for more information. Better yet, drop by to see us in person!
Comments: The cinnamon rolls. My friend, the cinnamon rolls, they are exceptional. They only have a limited amount, usually available in the morning until they’re sold out, but the cinnamon rolls are marvelous. If you're able to withstand feelings of gluttony or social anxiety stemming from the thought that the barista is judging you (they're not), order two. Eat one right away, warm the other one up when you get home. That's how to properly evaluate a cinnamon roll. You must have it in both states, as each is valid in its own right.

Place: Knowledge Perk Coffee Company | Rock Hill

Description:
Rock Hill, South Carolina's original hometown coffee roaster! Come relax in our beautiful flagship café with indoor and outdoor seating. We offer fresh roasted coffee, cold brew, a full range of expert espresso beverages, seasonal drink menu, and a variety of sweet and savory pastry and bagel creations.
All coffee is roasted in house and is available onsite or via our website for retail purchase. We have immersive, engaging programs and events for our community to grow in their knowledge and enjoyment of coffee. Address: 7201 Matthews-Mint Hill Rd, Mint Hill, NC 28227
Description:
Coffee shop by day and wine bar vibes at night. Check us out for natural wines, local craft beers, and a selection of handmade cocktails, as well as, light far served from open to close. We have a small but excellent selection of wines to go as well. With the largest selection of natural wines in Mint Hill.
Whether your thing is coffee, tea, boba, fresh hand-squeezed lemonade, beer, wine or anything in between this is the place to go for absolutely delicious beverages all day long.
Comments: Sits in a converted house with plenty of seating across the indoor and outdoor areas. It’s a similar vibe to Brakeman’s in Matthews. Has that homey community gathering spot feel, in part because it’s literally in a home, but also because they host plenty of events and gatherings for various groups in the area. Customers and staff alike look very relaxed, at home even, here. There’s sufficient spots near outlets for remote workers and plenty of parking behind the house. They have cinnamon rolls, not the cute bite sized kind, proper fully formed cream cheese frosting cinnamon rolls, and they are sublime.

Description: Bustling taproom & beer garden offering in-house sandwiches & international food-truck fare.
Comments: Gigantic space. Two floors and extends into an even larger foyer area. Coffee shop downstairs during the day. An abundance of places to sit, some having outlet access. Biggest drawback is paid parking, but that’s a South End challenge in general.

Address: 14825 Ballantyne Village Way Suite 135, Charlotte, NC 28277
Description: Coffee Republic in Ballantyne Village is the best coffee shop near you! Enjoy artisanal coffee, fresh pastries, and a welcoming ambiance. Whether grabbing a quick cup or relaxing with friends, our café is your go-to spot for quality coffee and treats.
Comments: Lot's of food and pastry options that all look great. Not a ton of seating though, most of it is upstairs and it's a compact space with limited access to outlets. If you come here to work/study and can't find seat, whip around the corner to the Panera Bread nearby which is large, you'll certainly find seating. Or the Sunflour Bakery (my favorite of all their locations), Summit Coffee, and Starbucks all in the same area. Ballantyne has it's own third place thing going on.

Description:
Serving the community of Ballantyne with locally owned craft coffee, homemade pastries, beer, and wine! 🥐☕️🩵
#findyoursummit
Comments: Small but charming.

Provided Coffee Uptown is a mini-cafe located inside of designer store, Street Commerce as well as a mobile coffee cart that serves an assortment of handcrafted espresso beverages and bottled drinks to the Greater Carolinas. We now have a second location opening in Concord on Oct. 6th, 2023!

Founded by two best friends at 18 years old, Provided aims to create an atmosphere of community wherever travelled. As coffee can act as a bridge of connection between others, the customer can expect "special experiences in unusual places."

Address: 120 Brevard Court Suite A, Charlotte, NC 28202
Description: My Story Cafe is a coffee shop in Charlotte, NC. Our experienced staff provides friendly and prompt service for a remarkable cafe experience. We value our customers and strive to satisfy your coffee cravings by serving you our cafe's best and tastiest recipes. Our coffee shop is the perfect place to meet with family and friends. We are friendly and care about your experience at our cafe. We are confident that one visit will satisfy your cravings and give you an unforgettable day.
Comments: In the Latta Arcade business center, so plenty of other great attractions nearby for making this a trip. It is super small, seating for maybe 5-6 people indoors, but plenty of outdoor seating because of the business center. Food options galore in addition to getting a drink here.

Description:
Freshly Baked, Everyday

Since our launch into the United States in 2004, TOUS les JOURS [meaning "everyday" in French] has developed into a reputable neighborhood bakery specializing in French-Asian inspired baked goods, hand crafted beverages and bold, flavorful coffee and espresso made with the finest ingredients.

With a commitment to using only the finest ingredients, our products are known for their unique flavors and wholesome qualities. Our skilled bakers create a wide array of delicious treats that are freshly baked and ready to be enjoyed by our customers seeking exceptional taste and quality.
Comments: Small but connected indoors to SipCha Bubble Tea, so you have more drinks and seating options. Friendly staff.

Description: We were the first specialty coffee shop in Lake Norman and are now expanding to Belmont. Our goal is to create a space where you can have business meetings, study, hang out, or simply grab a quick cup of coffee to-go. We aim to be your home away from home.

Wake is an exclusive, yet inclusive Coffee & Champagne Bar. Specialty drinks and cocktails are served with style and finesse. Whether you're here for an intimate date or with a group of friends our staff will serve you with hospitality and excellence, The Wake Way.
Our staff is well qualified in the techniques and quality ingredients used to create our crafted drinks; coffee and cocktails. Enjoy an afternoon or evening of charcuterie, high end pastries with your choice of coffee, champagne, wine, or beer.
Our vision was to create an exclusive experience for our community through hospitality while highlighting Charlotte's hidden gem, Mtn. Island Lake.

*Please Check our Instagram for the latest updates regarding liquor, alcohol.
Comments: Small space but they make good use of it to fit seating. They have small cubicle style areas near the back where you can work/study, but they’re paid spaces. So paid mini co-working spaces, can’t just pop into one. But they also have limited general seating in the front of the store that’s open to all. They have coffee, tea, treats (ice cream, pastries), and a bar. They have cinnamon rolls that they get from Sam’s club, cream cheese frosting. I know this because I’m plugged into the cinnamon roll scene of greater Charlotte. It’s something of an area of expertise for me. They’re marvelous cinnamon rolls, better warm, but amazing regardless. They’ve got some unique tea options, sourced locally.

Description: The country of Yemen is unapparelled to any other place on this Earth. From its breathtaking scenery to its history that dates back to the beginning of man. Yemen is the homeland of our family. As first-generation immigrants, we wanted to honor our heritage. Yemen is where coffee was invented and later flourished in global trade. Roasting and serving coffee is something that is inclusive of all people and cultures, and brings people together. Our coffee is grown from altitudes over 3,000 ft in a mountainous village called Haraz, where our namesake originates.
Comments: Immaculate vibes. One of the few places open later so if you need to really get some work done or study, this is a good place to hangout. Very popular date spot though, so it can be tough to find a space to sit if you go during peak hours. There’s two parking options: behind the store and across the street on Hawthorne (behind 1124 Central Ave).

Description: The Salty Donut, an artisan donut & coffee shop located in South End, Charlotte.
A locally owned coffee shop in Charlotte, NC offering indoor/outdoor seating, to-go, and catering for private events.
Craft coffee, homemade baked goods, beer & wine!

Address: 4400 Sharon Rd Space G23D, Charlotte, NC 28211
1500 W Morehead St E, Charlotte, NC 28208
Description: Cool deli for eclectic sandwiches & a market with beer, wine & readymade pastas, plus local breads.
Comments: The SouthPark location is one of my favorite spots in the city, but this one is alright. Small but serviceable.
This is inside a larger office/retail building that has plenty of seating in the lobby area. If you go in the morning, get the French Toast, it’s good.

Description: Cool deli for eclectic sandwiches & a market with beer, wine & readymade pastas, plus local breads.

Deli breakfast & lunch sandwiches, draft & craft beer, coffee, fine wine, N/A beverages, snacks.

Delivery available through Postmates.
Comments: Good access to outlets, deli style food, convenience store, coffee and tea, bar, solid amount of seating indoors and outdoors. Great spot. Parking is free, there's more in the garage behind the building if you can't find something right in front. The SouthPark location is still my favorite, but there's no bad Rhino Market!

Description:
A modern and welcoming coffee shop in Steele Creek serving up specialty coffee drinks, scratch-made sandwiches, salads, and pastries. Javesca exists to be a catalyst for change in the coffee community by giving a portion of our gross revenue back to feeding and community transformation initiatives in the United States and abroad through our sister Non-Profit Javesca Feeds.

Indoor Playground available as part of Steele Creek Community Center

Public Playground hours are:
Mon, Tues, Th: 8am - 4pm
Wed: 1pm - 4pm
Fri: 11am - 4pm
Sat: 8am - 12pm
Sun: Closed

Sunflour Baking Company is the Charlotte bakery & cafe you have been looking for! Come visit our five locations to get a taste of our fresh brewed coffee or small batch, homemade pastries and breads.Since 2009, Sunflour Baking Company has been a local favorite in the Noda neighborhood as well as for customers all around Charlotte and beyond. People all over the country order our Cake Jars every day!We invite you to come to visit our local cafes. They are all great spots to hang out, get work done, catch up with friends or enjoy some quiet time. We are sure you will love our bright, friendly interiors and of course our pastry case.
Comments: They have what I consider to be the best cinnamon rolls in Charlotte. I suggest getting two, eat one right away, and save the other for eating at home after warming it up. As a general rule, I’d encourage you to refrain from offering your opinion about a cinnamon roll until you’ve had it both cold and warm. Things can taste rather different heated up, flavors coming out, for better or worse. They can sell out of cinnamon rolls pretty quickly sometimes though, if you show up after like 11 AM, no guarantees. The sandwiches are also pretty good. Be warned though, the whole menu is expensive. Like, I’ll go in here and buy 2 things and get asked for $28 and be just flabbergasted. But the cinnamon rolls, they wash it all away. So it’s worth it. The gigantic rice krispy treat they have sometimes also slaps.

Description: This cheerful gathering place draws a crowd for its pastries, light fare & coffee drinks.
Comments: This place is huge. You have the entry level with plenty of seating, but also an upstairs that can easily seat 30 people and a downstairs (that’s sometimes blocked off for private events) that can fit a good chunk of people as well. The only thing about Uptown is if you're driving, you'll have to pay for parking. But if you're on the rail trail or walking distance, definitely make the trek over here.

Description: Daytime hangout serving a simple menu of pastries, sandwiches & coffee made using local ingredients.
Stylish coffee bar offering pour-overs, cold brew & espresso, tea, food, and baked goods.
Comments: This is in Camp North End, parking is free in the large lot back  . They have some really fancy named teas and they’re all incredible. If you get it “for here”, they give you a nice cup and this fancy kettle pot thing to pour it from. The food is good, they give you a lot of it for the price. It’s not small cute coffee shop meals, it’s a full restaurant style plate of food. They have orange flavored cinnamon rolls sometimes 🔥💯. Lots of windows, gives the place a bright and energetic feel. Excellent access to outlets as well. Great music playlist, good vibes. Awesome day trip for remote workers, Camp North End has a lot to explore. Start at Hex, walk around after work, and end at Heist Brewery. Solid day.

Description: Deli sandwiches, breakfast sandwiches, coffee, fine wine, craft beer
Comments: Great spot to work from during the day. Only gets crowded during lunch, but even then there's a lot of seating indoors and outdoors so you can almost always find a spot. Tea, coffee, deli, and a convenience store inside. S-tier remote work spot. Everything you need is there. It becomes a bar in the evenings (or early afternoon for the day drinkers). If you sit at the bar, there’s outlets underneath the table. They're open until 9 or 10 PM most days.

Description: Change Please is where social enterprise and coffee expertise blend. We train and employ people experiencing homelessness as baristas and put 100% of our profits towards giving our employees fair wage jobs, housing, therapy support, childcare, healthcare, onward job opportunities and more.
Counter-serve bakery/cafe chain serving sandwiches, salads & more, known for its bread & free WiFi.

Quaint cafe/bar in the McGill Rose Garden with hot drinks, craft beer & wines, plus photo sessions.
Hip site with a wide variety of food & bar stands plus art, events & indoor-outdoor seating.
Comments: A Charlotte staple. Parking is free for only the first 1.5 hours. It's a hall with a lot of businesses and plenty of seating, although most seating is not situated near outlets. It gets loud here, so not great if you're looking for a cozy laid back vibe, but great if you're looking for some energy.

Description: Charlotte coffee shop in the Uptown neighborhood known for their locally roasted beans.

Good energy, local coffee, craft beer, and CATS, right in the heart of two beautiful historic districts in North Carolina: NoDa, Charlotte and Downtown Concord! Twelve adoptable cats roam the CAT LOUNGE - and they are ready to play! Our CAFE is separate and offers coffee, wine, craft beer and more!
Comments: This is exactly what the name suggests. A café filled with cats you can hangout with.

Description: Calder the Hockey Pup, In-House Coffee Roasting, Home of CHAR-LATTE, Local Breakfast Burrito's, Fresh Cafe Pastries, Beer & Wine Lounge, Rooftop Patio, Healthy Lunch Wraps, Togo Salad Bowls, Daily Espresso Specials, Bike Friendly Coffee Shop.
Comments: There's a really sweet and gentle service dog that works here.

Description: Local bakery chain serving Charlotte and nearby neighborhoods since 2009. Fresh from scratch pastries, breads, coffee, sandwiches, and more. Whether you are looking for a quiet place to work and get fast free WiFi, or need to place a large catering order, our bakery can't be beat. Looking for lunch? We serve fresh made sandwiches every day of the week. Visit us on East 7th Street today, or shop online and ship fresh baked goods nationwide.
Comments: They have what I consider to be the best cinnamon rolls in Charlotte. I suggest getting two, eat one right away, and save the other for eating at home after warming it up. As a general rule, I’d encourage you to refrain from offering your opinion about a cinnamon roll until you’ve had it both cold and warm. Things can taste rather different heated up, flavors coming out, for better or worse. They can sell out of cinnamon rolls pretty quickly sometimes though, if you show up after like 11 AM, no guarantees. The sandwiches are also pretty good. Be warned though, the whole menu is expensive. Like, I’ll go in here and buy 2 things and get asked for $28 and be just flabbergasted. But the cinnamon rolls, they wash it all away. So it’s worth it. The gigantic rice krispy treat they have sometimes also slaps.

Airy cafe/used bookshop benefiting Habitat for Humanity offers free WiFi & seating in a loft.
Comments: Hogwarts. Hogwarts vibes. It's connected to a Habitat for Humanity store internally so you can get some shopping done after reading. I wouldn't suggest this place as a "work from" spot. It's more a "read, relax, chill" sort of place. Check their website for more details about their Habitat for Humanity connection.

Description: Enderly Coffee Company is a family owned coffee roaster based in Charlotte, NC focused on great coffee and doing GOOD in our world through our beans.
Comments: Small but it always smells really good in here. There’s some cool abstract art on the walls. Limited parking right behind the building.

Description: Stylish cafe for gourmet coffee, sandwiches & pastries in a chic space with lots of seating options.
Comments: The indoors is connected to a hotel which has additional seating if it’s crowded in the main area. Great vibes here. Plenty of remote workers huddled inside. It's a common recommendation among remote workers and students in Charlotte for good reason. The vibes. The vibes are A+. They have cronuts. The only thing is, it's in Uptown, so you're paying for parking if you drive. Worth it though, at least once to check it out.

Description: This funky store with a variety of goods houses an all-day eatery & deli with a bar & live music.
Comments: Lots of seating, great sandwiches, coffee, a bar, various convenience store offerings. Eclectic, punk sort of vibes in terms of aesthetic. Feels lived in, authentic. You'll see plenty of remote workers on their laptops during the day. When you make a deli order, they ask your name then announce it over a loudspeaker when its ready. Gave me grade school nostalgia, being called to the office. Good luck if you have a tough name, I use a simplified version of mine to avoid embarrassment. The biggest challenge here is outlet access, so come charged up.

Description: Popular spot offering draft brews & deli sandwiches amid a convenience store, plus outdoor seating.
Comments: Indoor seating is mostly bar style, high chairs, but there's additional outdoors. Great spot for a warm day. Convenience store, deli, bar, coffee, and really cool punk/alt vibes. The convenience store has a wider selection of random snacks and drinks than a gas station typically would have, which I appreciate. Parking is free behind the store but limited, especially during peak hours.

Description: Popular spot offering draft brews & deli sandwiches amid a convenience store, plus outdoor seating.
Comments: This place is spacious, with indoor and outdoor seating on the main floor, plus an upstairs area with more seating and a small patio. Very alt-punk/rock aesthetic, which I personally love—I grew up in Seattle. It feels like the kind of spot the crew from a 2000s coming-of-age film (the ones who get bullied by the popular kids and listen to Radiohead, Dashboard Confessional, and Yellowcard) would hang out, talking through their trauma and how much they want to "get out of this town." And I mean that in the best way possible (I may have just listed some of my favorite bands). This place is awesome. The music is on point. I don’t even bother with headphones unless it’s packed. Truly a standout when it comes to vibes. A heads-up: there’s some access to outlets upstairs, but not a lot, so come charged up. If you’re a morning person, you can practically have the whole place to yourself if you show up early. It doesn’t get busy until the afternoon. Parking is the biggest challenge—there’s free parking near the store, but it’s limited. Street parking and nearby lots are options, though not always free. South End is designed for walking and light rail access, which is great unless you’re coming from another neighborhood and need your car. Not complaining though, just making a note.

Outstanding, truly fantastic, access to outlets here. Bravo to whoever designed the space, with a nice bright, clean, aesthetic as well. Great tea options. Try the Qi Dan Red Robe Oolong if you want to expand your palette. I know it's a coffee shop, but I'm a tea person, so as you read my comments on this site, that's what you'll see me reviewing drink wise. Parking is free in the angled spots in front of the store but time limited (2 hours). There's paid lots in the area if you want to stay a while. There's a Common Market within walking distance, great spot for lunch, and also to hangout when it's warm outside, plenty of outdoor seating.

Address: 1115 N Brevard St Stall #7, Charlotte, NC 28206
Description: Full service coffee and tea bar also serving healthy, vegan forward breakfast and lunch options.

Description: Specialty Coffee Shop
Specialty Coffee Shop, Sandwiches, Mochi, Pastries.
Comments: Their Waterbean special sandwich is amazing. They also have a pretty broad selection of teas compared to most coffee shops. They’re displayed in little metal tins that you can pick up and smell, so whoever designed/runs Waterbean definitely has love for tea drinkers like myself.

Description: Specialty coffee shop, Desert, Pastries, Tea
Comments: Their Waterbean Special sandwich is amazing. They also have a pretty broad selection of teas compared to most coffee shops. They’re displayed in little metal tins that you can pick up and smell, so whoever designed/runs Waterbean definitely has love for tea drinkers like myself.

The Waterbean Special sandwich is amazing. They also have ice cream, which isn't a thing at all Waterbean locations. This location's interior is compact, but they have a large outdoor patio area that's well spaced and can comfortably sit 35-40 people at a time.

Description: Independent coffee shop with breakfast, house-baked pastries & baklava, brick walls & a fireplace.
Specialty coffee shop, craft beer, wine cocktail bar as well as local pastries, free live music

Comments: The seating mostly comes from the Starbucks inside which is right in the middle of the store, and there's a moderate amount. At one point, they had signs up saying that visitors shouldn't sit for more than an hour. That might no longer be a thing, but there's a Panera nearby as a backup if you drive here and can' t find a spot to sit.

Description: Bookseller chain stocking housebrand eReader, plus a broad selection of titles for adults & kids.
Comments: Not a ton of seating in the downstairs Starbucks, not a ton of the cozy couches Barnes & Nobles are known for, and it's connected to the mall, so lot's of traffic from there. Limited access to outlets as well. Personally, I wouldn't go out of my way to frequent this Barnes & Noble. If you're driving to this area, Waterbean Pineville and the Pineville Library aren't too far from here. Better options in my opinion.

Comments: I think Panera is overpriced and the food is middling at best but the interior set up and organization as a place to read, study, or work remotely remains excellent across most all their locations, this one included. Also, they have cinnamon rolls, and they’re quite alright. Nothing remarkable, but certainly passable.

But if you go up the escalator right outside you can access the Overstreet mall for other seating options.

Comments: I consider this spot a hidden gem. The seating is outside the coffee shop in a general atrium sort of area for the whole building, and there's plenty of it. You have to walk around the corner to the hallway adjacent to the YMCA to see all of it. Good view of Uptown, great lighting from big windows. Yeah. Great spot. It's Uptown though, so if you're driving, you'll have to pay for parking.

Description: Relaxed spot serving high-end coffee drinks, plus tea & light fare in an airy space with a patio.
Contemporary spot serving high-end coffee drinks, plus tea & light fare like toasts & yogurt.
Comments: This is inside The Market at 7th Street so you have the whole building as your third place while you're there. Plenty of food and cool stores within the building.

Comments: Large, spread out, airy interior.

Comments: Sits in a converted home, very cozy, very welcoming, very warm, very, dare I say, demure? Between outdoors, the first floor of the house, and the upstairs area, there's a good amount of seating. The parking situation however can be challenging during peak times. There's about 6-8 spots right behind the shop and a handful more directly in front. Great atmosphere for working remotely, meeting friends, or just vibing. It's everything a third place is supposed to be. Coffee and tea is great, and they have great pastries as well. Awesome spot!

Description: Vibe Café & Bar brings a unique experience to the Dilworth Neighborhood of Charlotte, NC. Not only is it a place where you can drop by for your morning cup of coffee and breakfast, but also where you can enjoy an original, soul food inspired menu with our European Cocktails, unlike you have ever tasted before.
Comments: You can get a pot of tea here, really relaxing jazz bar sort of interior vibes. They offer traditional Russian desserts and beverages.

Description: Come unplug, relax, and experience a cup of serenity at the Pauline Tea-Bar Apothecary! Sip or purchase an herbal tea, spend time in contemplative solace, or experience creative play with a friend or group! Also register for one of our holistic classes and gain greater clarity or nourishment for your soul!
Comments: I'm a tea person, so I love this place. I wouldn't go here to work because I feel like with how cool the vibe is, it's better to not think about work here. Sip tea, read a good book, chill out. Lovely place.

Like the kind on football fields. It's a great spot for studying/working because of the upstairs section where you can get away from the visual distractions of the store below. Amazon bought Whole Foods all those years ago and have done quite well with it. Bravo.

Description: Coffeehouse chain serving signature drinks, mochas & lattes, plus coffee & breakfast.
Comments: A favorite study spot for students in the area. Not a ton of space, but what they have, they use well. Caribou has an extra large size for hot drinks that's beyond the Starbucks venti. For that alone, I prefer their locations. Also the sandwiches are better.

Description: A fun coffee shop and gathering space featuring a pool table, comfortable indoor and outdoor seating, themed event nights, puzzles and various board games.
Comments: This place is in the bottom of an apartment building and across from a bunch of stores. As a result, it's popular just about every day of the week. If you want to be social and talk to people, it'd be a great spot to post up. They have a pool table and various events put on by the apartment complex (karaoke night, trivia night, stuff like that) from time to time. There’s very limited parking directly in front of the store but plenty more in the light rail parking garage. The staff will validate your ticket if you use the garage. Seating by outlets can be tough, maybe 2-3 spots have access, so come charged up.

Description: A brewery, coffee bar, American eatery & fermentation lab share their products all under one roof.
Comments: Hot spot in South End for a younger crowd of remote workers. Coffee bar during the day, brewery in the evenings. Parking is free, it's a gravel lot you kind of have to keep an eye out for. Doesn't stick out from the street.

Description: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.
Comments: Right next to Costco. Get some work done then go shopping. Get a hot dog and a rotisserie chicken (may they forever remain $5).

Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.
Comments: This Starbucks is unique in that it sites within a converted home. Very popular spot, lot's of seating, lot's of remote workers and students hanging out.

Description: Non-profit restaurant serving breakfasts, sandwiches & salads amid warehouse-style decor.
Comments: Check out their website for details about their mission as a business. Worth visiting just to support the cause!

Address: 1440 S Tryon St UNIT 110, Charlotte, NC 28203
Description: Modern redbrick brewery with a rotating selection of draft and to-go beers, plus a beer garden.

Place: Charlotte Mecklenburg Library | South County Regional
Description: The Charlotte Mecklenburg Library is one of America’s leading urban public libraries, serving a community of more than one million citizens in Mecklenburg County, North Carolina. Through 20 locations, targeted outreach and online, the Library delivers exceptional services and programs, with a mission to improve lives and build a stronger community. In short, we strive to be essential to our community.
Comments: One of the best libraries in the area. Large quiet room, large general seating areas both upstairs and downstairs, plenty of nooks and crannies to cozy up in. A+ interior design. Vending machines downstairs if you need a snack or drink. Quality.

Description: Specialty coffee, local pastries, craft beer and wine.
Your newest neighborhood café, serving specialty coffee, beer, and wine with passion
Airy, laid-back brewpub pouring house beers paired with wood-fired pizzas & other modern bar bites.
Bookseller chain stocking housebrand eReader, plus a broad selection of titles for adults & kids.
Comments: They have a good set of the comfy couches both downstairs and upstairs, but mostly upstairs. The Starbucks within here is good sized as well, so it's not hard to find seating somewhere. A very good Barnes & Noble. Lot's of people hangout here to read, study, work remote, etc.

Description: Bitty & Beau’s Coffee is more than just a place to grab a cup of coffee — it’s an experience. The shop is run by people with disabilities and guests love the vibe — come see for yourself!
Comments: Check out their website for the story of the business. Great mission, great values, great staff, great people.

Place: Night Swim Coffee | Bank of America Tower
Address: 620 S Tryon St Suite 150, Charlotte, NC 28202
Description: Night Swim Coffee was born in Charlotte, North Carolina as the centerpiece of a unified venture for Not Just Coffee and Undercurrent Coffee to create a specialty coffee roaster in Charlotte. In our cafes, Night Swim Coffee offers the same thoughtfully prepared food and beverages, attention to detail, and hospitable atmosphere that is enjoyed in the legacy Not Just Coffee and Undercurrent Coffee cafes, but in a setting designed in a collaborative effort across the team to create a unique experience at every location.

Address: 1620 Oakhurst Commons Dr Suite 306, Charlotte, NC 28205
Comments: The cinnamon sugar bagel is very good, they give you a generous amount of cream cheese. Like, almost too much, which I consider to be a good thing. Also they have a solid tea menu, not an overwhelming amount of choices, but the ones they have are a step above your standard Earl Grey, English Breakfast, and Jasmine Green teas. I'm a tea person, so any spot with good tea automatically becomes a favorite of mine. If you get the tea "for here" they give you a nice mug and a little glass holder thing with extra tea and a plate and sometimes even a gold colored (not actual gold) spoon. Very quaint. Very posh. Very "demure". I know I'm not using that word right. I don't care.

Description: Here at Waterbean Coffee, we always try to stay original and never follow the trends. In a time when most coffee shops focus on getting the customers in and out of their doors the quickest, we try to give them a place to relax, hold meetings, go over schoolwork, or just hang out with friends. We want to be more than just another coffee shop. Our founder’s international background brings a unique aspect to the space that most people don’t have. This is reflected from our menu options all the way down to our store designs. One of Tony’s favorite quotes is from Henry Ford: “Quality means doing it right when no one is looking.”
Tous les Jours means "every day"in French.Tous les Jours is a "French-Asian-inspired" bakery primarily serving a selection of baked goods and beverages.
Comments: I've been told the WiFi password is on the bottom of your receipt should you choose to hangout here. When Tous les Jours first came to Charlotte, I was like "wow what a cool spot", then a friend from New York  was like "lol y'all really think this is special". They're a chain. Not that that should impact your opinion of them, just don't go thinking it's a Charlotte local spot.

Description: Coffee shop providing area-sourced java & pastries in a chill space with local artwork & free Wi-Fi.
Comments: About as close to a Charlotte third place institution as you can get in this city where everything, for better or worse, feels so new. You've got writers clubs that meet here, book clubs that meet here, D&D clubs that meet here, business people that take meetings here, students that study here, remote workers that work from here, it's well traveled, and for good reason. Great spot. Maybe hard to find seating during peak times, but round the corner to nearby Panera Bread, Rhino Market SouthPark, Summit Coffee SouthPark, or Tous les Jours if you can't find a spot here.

Description: Eco-minded chain with natural & organic grocery items, housewares & other products (most sell wine).
Comments: There’s downstairs seating across the whole checkout area but also an upstairs with more seating and an outdoor patio. Great spot, the only challenge is there are no publicly accessible outlets upstairs. You’ve got to come charged up.

Description: Coffeehouse chain serving signature drinks, mochas & lattes, plus coffee & breakfast.
Comments: This spot shares a space with a Bruegger's Bagels and as a result is rather large. Great access to outlets, plenty of seating, drinks from Caribou and food from Bruegger's. Great remote work spot. It also gets surprisingly calm after the lunch rush since Bruegger's closes before Caribou. It can be quite chill in the afternoons. There's also two large tables back behind the checkout counters where the restrooms are for extra seating.

Description: The Charlotte Mecklenburg Library is one of America’s leading urban public libraries, serving a community of more than one million citizens in Mecklenburg County, North Carolina. Through 20 locations, targeted outreach and online, the Library delivers exceptional services and programs, with a mission to improve lives and build a stronger community. In short, we strive to be essential to our community.
Comments: My favorite library of the many marvelous ones in Charlotte. In addition to plenty of interior seating, they have a patio upstairs that overlooks this mini park area with a fountain. Great spot to read, or just sit outside and be on your laptop since the Wi-Fi extends out there.

Description: Counter-serve bakery/cafe chain serving sandwiches, salads & more, known for its bread & free WiFi.
Comments: I think Panera is overpriced and the food is middling at best but the interior set up and organization as a place to read, study, or work remotely remains excellent across most all their locations, this one included. Also, they have cinnamon rolls, and they’re quite alright. Nothing remarkable, but certainly passable. This location gets a lot of traffic during lunchtime from the nearby office park but is mostly chill after that. It’s across the street from Summit Coffee SouthPark and Tous Les Jours SouthPark and Rhino Market SouthPark so if you drive to this area, you have options.

Description: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.
Comments: This is inside a very large Harris Teeter, but it's on the list because there's a good amount of seating, including a covered patio/outdoors spot. Go get some food from the hot bar, then head in here, get your drink, and hangout.

Description: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.
Comments: This spot has an upstairs section that gives a cool sense of seclusion. It's the only Starbucks I know of in Charlotte with an upstairs. Whole Foods is right around the corner, so if you drive to this area, you've got options.

Address: 157 E Main St, Rock Hill, SC 29730
Description: This charming gathering place draws a crowd for its pastries, light fare & coffee drinks.
Comments: This whole area of town has several third places all within walking distance. You could drive, park, and spend a day walking between this Amelie's, The Mercantile, Rock Hill Coffee, and Knowledge Perk. It's worth the drive if you're in Charlotte and haven't gone down to Rock Hill yet. Finish your day at Fountain Park for nice views and a calm relaxing atmosphere. Bring a book!

Description: This charming gathering place draws a crowd for its pastries, light fare & coffee drinks.
Comments: This isn't the original Amelie's if you've been in Charlotte long enough to remember that. They moved, so this is the new "original" in a way. The interior design is better than the original, it's bigger, the seating is arranged such that there's plenty of spots for 1-2 people to sit that are out of the way of the bigger tables. The food might be overpriced but I don't go for the food. I'm there for vibes. The vibes are great.

Description: This charming gathering place draws a crowd for its pastries, light fare & coffee drinks.
Comments: Seating by outlets at this location can be a little tricky here so come with a full charge. Other than that, as is consistent across all Amelie's, it's a great place to hangout and read, work, study, chill, etc.

Description: This charming gathering place draws a crowd for its pastries, light fare & coffee drinks.
Comments: One of my favorites. Large space, plenty of seating, excellent, and I mean excellent, organization of seating nearby outlets. There's a raised seating area featuring a row of booth-style seats along the wall. Beneath the padded backs, you'll find a discreet black strip with outlets available for use. They’re easy to overlook, but they’re there! If you frequent this location, as I do, you'll see the same people a lot. Working, reading, studying, etc. Great way to make friends if you're new to the city. Food, pastries (cinnamon rolls🔥) coffee, tea (pro tip, you can get a whole pot of tea. Just ask. It's not on the displayed menu, but it's on the menu). Everything you need to stay a while.
